loans.name: Nyankor

texts.en:
Nyankor lives in Bor. She has a food stall, and has been in business for one year. She is 32 years old, married, and has six children, five of whom are still in school. 

Nyankor heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase sugar and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and beans for sale.

loans.name: Agok

texts.en:
Agok lives in Bor. She has a food stall, and has been in business for four years. She is 32 years old, married, and has six children, five of whom are still in school. 

Agok heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy paint.

loans.name: Faizali

texts.ru: Файзали добрый и трудолюбивый человек, он женат и на воспитании имеет четверых детей. Более одного года он занимается предоставлением услуг по перевозке грузов (автоперевозкой). Он также дополнительно занимается купле- продажей продуктов питания. Его жена занимается домохозяйством. Файзали запрашивает займ для покупки запчастей для своей автомашины, а также продуктов питания для своего магазина. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Faizali is a kind and hardworking man. He is married and is raising four children. He has been providing a freight delivery service for more than one year. Additionally he also buys and sells food. His wife is a homemaker. Faizali is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for his vehicle and also food for his store. He is hoping for your help and generosity.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and food for his store.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам опытный человек в сфере сельского хозяйства. Он женат и на воспитании имеет шестерых детей и одного внука. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Более 19 лет он занимается выращиванием хлопка и кукурузы. В бизнесе помогают его два сына. Рустам хотел бы получить займ для покупки семян, минеральных удобрений, горюче смазочных материалов и оплаты услуг техники.
texts.en: Rustam is an experienced man in the field of agriculture. He is married and has six children and one grandson. His wife is a homemaker. Rustam has been cultivating cotton and corn for more than nineteen years. His two sons help him in the business. Rustam wants to get a loan to buy seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuel and lubricants and to pay for rented equipment.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuel and lubricants.

loans.name: Adau

texts.en:
Adau lives in Bor. She has a food stall, and has been in business for one year. She is 30 years old, married, and has six children, four of whom are still in school. 

Adau heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase sugar and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and beans for sale.

loans.name: Cruz Helena

texts.es:
Cruz Helena es una persona que ha tenido una gran fortaleza para superar todas las adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida. Cruz Helena es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de 4 hijos, ya que su esposo murió hace aproximadamente 8 años y ella quedó a cargo de todas las obligaciones de su hogar. Durante un largo tiempo estuvo divagando en diferentes labores con el ánimo de generar los ingresos que requería para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar, y desde hace aproximadamente 4 años tomó un curso de artesanías donde aprendió a pintar cuadros y viene trabajando con esto de entonces. Los primeros diseños los vendía a sus amigos y familiares, y al ver que los productos tuvieron mucha acogida, siguió pintando para ofrecer a muchas personas y así generar los ingresos para su hogar. Actualmente Cruz Helena tiene una gran clientela y esto le ha permitido tener muy buenos pedidos, y con el ánimo de entregar los que tiene pendientes busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de insumos y materias primas para pintar los cuadros.

De esta manera su negocio seguirá creciendo al poder entregar los pedidos a tiempo, además podrá seguir generando los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar y así ofrecer a sus 4 hijos una buena calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas.
texts.en:
Cruz Helena is a person with great strength that she has needed to overcome all of the adversity in her life.  Cruz Helena is a single mother of four children as her husband died about eight years ago and she took on all of the obligations of the household.  For a long time she went from job to job trying to earn enough income to sustain her household and four years ago she took an art class where she learned to paint pictures and since then she has worked doing this.  She sold her first pieces to family and friends and when she saw how well-received they were she continued painting in order to offer them to more people and earn income for her household.  Cruz Helena currently has a large clientele and this has allowed her to have many orders and with the aim of completing her current orders she is requesting a loan which will give her the opportunity to purchase materials and supplies to paint the pictures.

In this way her business will continue to grow as she will be able to deliver the orders on time and will also be able to continue earning the necessary income to maintain her household expenses and offer her children a better quality of life and better economic  opportunities.

loans.use: to buy materials and supplies for painting pictures.

loans.name: Sandra Verónica

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer soltera de 21 años y tiene un hijo de 2 años. Viven juntos en "Santo Domingo" que es la cuarta ciudad con más población del Ecuador. Su población va creciendo rápidamente ya que cuenta con un rico comercio y el mayor mercado ganadero del país. Su temperatura habitual es de unos 25.5°C  y a veces llega a los 38 °C. Toda la provincia de "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas"  figura como parte del territorio montañoso de la costa, de la cordillera occidental, históricamente conocida como Provincia de Yumbos y Capital de los Colibríes. Está ubicado en el trópico húmedo de América Latina. Es una provincia considerada nueva ya que fue creada en el 2007.

Sandra desea invertir en la compra de 8 cerditos y alimento balanceado. Criará a los cerditos en su granja para luego venderlos y tener mayores ingresos para de esta manera dar una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo. Este es su segundo crédito con Fundación Alternativa, que es la institución que estará entre Sandra y la comunidad KIVA. En su primer crédito esta mujer se ha destacado por la puntualidad en sus pagos. Ella está muy optimista, y deseamos que le vaya muy bien con esta inversión de tal manera que pueda estar más cerca de su sueño que es tener su casa propia y de esta manera asegurar el futuro de su hijo.
texts.en:
Sandra is 21 years old, she is single and she has a 2-year-old son. They live together in Santo Domingo, Ecuador’s fourth most inhabited town. Its population is rapidly growing, thanks to its flourishing trade and to the biggest livestock market of the country. Its temperature is generally around 25.5° C (77.9° F), sometimes reaching 38°C (100.4° F). The whole province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas is set in the mountain area of the coast, in the western range, also known as Provincia de Yumbos y Capital de los Colibríes (Yumbo Province and Capital of the Hummingbirds), and it is located in the humid tropic of Latin America. It is considered a new province, having been created in 2007.

Sandra wants to invest the loan in the purchase of 8 piglets and in animal feed. She will breed the piglets in her farm to then sell them and thus gain a better income, in order to offer a better standard of living to her son. This is her second loan with Fundación Alternativa, the institution through which Sandra connects to the Kiva community. During her first loan, she has stood out for being punctual with her repayments. She is very optimistic, and we wish her all the best with this investment, so that she will come closer to making her dream come true: to have a house of her own in order to grant a better future to her son.

loans.use: To buy 8 piglets and animal feed.

loans.name: Odiljon

texts.ru: Одилчон трудолюбивый и добрый человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Более 8 лет он работает в сфере сельского хозяйства. Он занимается выращиванием картошки, а также купле- продажей скота. В бизнесе он занимается один, а иногда его жена и дети помогают. На полученную прибыль хочет провести обряды хатнатуйи своего сына. Одилчон запрашивает займ для покупки семян и ядохимикатов.
texts.en: Odiljon is a hardworking and kind man. He is married and has three children. He has been working in the field of agriculture for more than eight years. He cultivated potatoes and also buys and sells cattle. Odiljon is alone in the business, but his wife and children help him sometimes. He wants to use the received profit to hold a circumcision ceremony (hatnatuyi) for his son. Odiljon is asking for a loan to buy seeds and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Fazliddin

texts.ru: Фазлиддин женат и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Более 15 лет он занимается купле- продажей напитков, мороженного и продуктов питания. Бизнес хорошо налажен и имеет опыт в бизнесе. Имеет свой автомобиль, на котором ежедневно реализует товар оптом в кишлаке. Он сам арендует магазин в центре города. В бизнесе помогают жена и его брат. Он начал свой бизнес с продажи молочных и хлебобулочных изделий. Фазлиддин хотел бы получить займ для покупки продуктов с целью расширения ассортимента товаров.
texts.en: Fazliddin is married and raising two children.  He has been involved in buying and selling beverages, ice-cream and food products for over 15 years.  The business is set up well, and Fazliddin has experience in this business.  He owns a car, which he uses daily to sell merchandise wholesale in a village.  Fazliddin leases a store in the city center.  His wife and brother help him with the business.  Fazliddin started his business with the sales of milk and bakery goods.  He wants to obtain this loan to buy products in order to expand the selection of merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.ru: Олимчон добрый и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет четверых несовершеннолетних детей. Последние 15 лет он занимается торговлей продуктов питания и хозяйственных товаров. Имеет маленький магазин в своем джамоате. Жена и сын помогают по бизнесу. Олимчон запрашивает займ для покупки продуктов для увлечения оборотного капитала и расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Olimjon is a kind and hardworking person.  He is married and raising four adolescent children.  He has been involved in selling food products and household goods for the last 15 years.  He has a small store in his village.  His wife and son help him with the business.  Olimjon is requesting this loan to buy food products in order to increase his working capital and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Alim

texts.en:
Alim lives in bor. She sells at a food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 40 years old, married, and has four children; three of them are still in school. 

Alim heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase onions and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions, beans for sale.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa es una persona muy trabajadora y siempre se ha caracterizado por querer ofrecer en su familia una mejor calidad de vida, es por esto que tiene un negocio con el cual contribuye económicamente para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Teresa se encuentra casada y tiene 5 hijos, y con su negocio ellos pueden acceder a una educación de mejor calidad y mayores oportunidades económicas. Teresa se dedica a la preparación y venta de comidas, negocio con el cual lleva trabajando 4 años aproximadamente y el cual le ha permitido tener ingresos con los cuales contribuye en su hogar a tener una mejor calidad de vida. Gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos, Teresa ha logrado atraer un gran número de clientes, y por esto tiene grandes pedidos en su negocio. Con el ánimo de seguir trabajando y seguir entregando los pedidos a sus clientes, Teresa busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus comidas y plásticos y empaques para ofrecerlos en una buena presentación a sus clientes.

De esta manera Teresa tendrá la oportunidad de seguir creciendo y seguir generando los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar, y así contribuir a tener una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Teresa is a very hardworking person and has always wanted to offer her family a better quality of life. That is why she owns a business which allows her to contribute financially to support her household and cover home expenses. Teresa is married and has five children. Thanks to her business they have access to a better quality education and to more economic opportunities.
Teresa works preparing and selling food. She has been in this business for approximately four years, and this has allowed her to contribute an income which helps her household have a better quality of life. 
Thanks to the good quality of her products, Teresa has been able to attract a great number of customers, and that is why her business receives large orders. She is eager to continue working and continue filling her customers' orders, which is why she is looking for a loan that will offer her the opportunity of purchasing supplies to prepare her food, as well as plastic and packaging to offer it to her customers with a good presentation.
This way Teresa will have the opportunity to keep growing and continue generating the necessary income to cover her home expenses, so that she can contribute to having a better quality of life and more opportunities for progress.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to prepare her food, as well as plastic and packaging to offer her customers a good presentation.

loans.name: Adhol

Adhol lives in bor. She sells at a food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 40 years old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school.

loans.use: to purchase onions, beans for sale.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, beans for sale.

loans.name: Elahi Hussain's Group

texts.en:
Elahi hussain is 51 years old married woman and by this relationship she has six children: four boys and two girls. All of her children besides her youngest daughter couldn’t get education due to financial constraints. 
Her remaining children are involved in different works. Her elder son operates a sweetmeat shop while her other three sons works in a motor workshop as mechanic. Her elder daughter helps Elahi in completing the embroider orders and generating the income for the family. 
Elahi’s husband is also a mechanic and runs a motor workshop where his sons help him in repairing the vehicles of customers.  
Elahi has requested for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s sweetmeat business. He will invest the loan in buying of material like sugar, cooking oil, milk and dry fruits in larger quantity for making sweetmeats in better quality for selling to his customers and increasing his sales. 
She is very confident that her son will make the positive use of money and expand his business further.

loans.use: To buy material for sweetmeat making and sales business

loans.name: Munawar's Group

texts.en:
Munawar is 43 years old married woman and by this relationship she has two sons. Her elder son does a government job on monthly wage while her younger son is free and don’t do anything. 
Munawar is a very caring & efficient business woman. She is involved in clothes sales business. She buys clothes from cloth shops and different cities and sells to her community and neighboring areas on profits. Her cloth collection admires by her customers a lot. She keeps herself up-to-date about the latest trends in fashion which helps her understanding her customer’s choices and demands. 
She has requested for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothes sales business. She will invest the loan in buying of clothes in larger quantity of different variety for reselling. 
She is hopeful that the loan investment will bring better financial results for her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes for selling

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio aprendió la actividad de la carpintería hace aproximadamente 30 años, pues sus hermanos mayores se dedicaban a esta actividad y se la enseñaron desde muy temprana edad. Gracias a esto, aprendió a hacer productos de muy buena calidad en las carpinterías de su hermano, y posteriormente decidió montar su propia carpintería aprovechando la experiencia que tenía en fabricar productos de muy buena calidad. El negocio que montó quebró al poco tiempo debido a los fuertes problemas de violencia que habían en su municipio, y por esto se vio obligado a trabajar en diferentes carpinterías como empleado y ganándose salarios muy bajos. Hace aproximadamente 2 años decidió volver a abrir su propia carpintería para probar de nuevo suerte y poder trabajar para su propia cuenta y ganándose un salario más alto que trabajando como empleado. Actualmente, Rogelio se encuentra casado y tiene 5 hijos y su carpintería sigue creciendo gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que allí fabrica. Además, su familia ha podido tener una mejor calidad de vida gracias al aumento en los ingresos de Rogelio. Con el ánimo de entregar pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes, Rogelio busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de madera para la fabricación de sus productos.

De esta manera podrá seguir entregando los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes y seguir teniendo un buen trabajo con un buen salario. Además, si su taller sigue creciendo espera que con mayores ingresos su familia pueda gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y sus 5 hijos tengan acceso a una educación de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Rogelio learned carpentry approximately 30 years ago because his older brothers did this work and taught it to him at a very young age.  Thanks to this he learned to make very good-quality products in his brother's workshop.  Later he decided to set up his own shop, making the most of the experience he had in making good-quality products.  The business he started went bankrupt very quickly because of severe problems with violence in the town, so he had to work in different carpentry workshops as an employee, and earning very low salaries.

About two years ago he decided once again to open his own shop, to try his luck again and be able to work on his own and earn a higher salary than working as an employee.  Currently Rogelio is married and has five children, and his shop continues to grow thanks to the good quality of products he makes there.  In addition, his family has been able to have a better quality of life thanks to Rogelio's increase in income.

With the intention of delivering the orders his customers have made, Rogelio is looking for a loan that gives him the opportunity to buy wood to make his products.  In this way he will be able to continue to deliver his customers' orders and have a good job with a good salary.  In addition, if his shop continues to grow, he hopes that with more income his family will be able to enjoy a better quality of life and his five children will have access to a better-quality education.

loans.use: to buy wood to make his products.

loans.name: Aluel

texts.en:
Aluel lives in bor. She sells at a food stall, and has been in business for two years. She is 22 years old, married, and has one children; is in school. 

Aluel heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase rice, beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans for sale.

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia is 38 years old married woman and by this relationship she has three children: two sons and one daughter. Besides her youngest son others are getting an education. 
Asia’s husband operates a food stall where he sells Punjabi food items called “Nan chanay and rice.” He sells his food items to his community people and makes good earnings. Asia helps him in cooking food for his stall so he provides better quality services to his customers and keeps on earning good for the family. He has been operating his business for the past 5 years and he got good reputation among his customers for his good quality and taste of food. 
She has requested for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy food material rice, spices, cooking oil, chick-peas, utensils and some chairs for making a sitting arrangement which will allow him improving his services on larger scale and serve more customers. 
She is hopeful that her husband’s business will be expanded further after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy food items, utensils and chairs for food stall business

texts.en:
Abuor lives in bor. She sells at a food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 25 years old, married, and has two children; all of them are still in school. 

Abuor heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase wheat flour, sweat potatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of her children.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sweet potatoes for sale.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

Nyaluak lives in bor. She sells at a food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 25 years old, married, and has four children; two of them are still in school.

loans.name: Mariela De Jesus

texts.es:
Mariela se encuentra casada y tiene 4 hijos a quienes les quiere brindar una buena calidad de vida y una estabilidad económicas para poder tener mayores oportunidades para progresar. Es por esto que montó su propio negocio con el fin de contribuir económicamente en su hogar, ya que los ingresos que genera su esposo no son suficientes para poder sostener todos los gastos de su hogar. Mariela montó un puesto de venta de comidas donde ofrece a sus clientes toda clase de comidas rápidas y gracias a esto puede tener unos ingresos para contribuir en su hogar. Por la buena calidad de sus productos y la buena atención que ofrece ha logrado atraer gran cantidad de clientes a su negocio y esto le ha permitido tener muy buenas ventas. Mariela busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de insumos que requiere para la preparación de sus comidas y así seguir trabajando su negocio.

De esta manera Mariela tendrá la oportunidad de seguir ofreciendo a su familia una buena calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades para progresar económicamente. Además sus 4 hijos podrán tener acceso a una mejor educación y en un futuro el acceso a una educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Mariela is married and has four children for whom she wishes to provide a good quality of life and economic stability so they can have better opportunities to do well in life. It is for these reasons that Mariela started her own business so she could contribute financially to the household. Her husband's income isn't sufficient to pay all the bills. She has a food stall selling all types of fast food and as a result has some income to contribute to the household. Because the meals she makes are of good quality and she gives good service, Mariela has succeeded in attracting many customers resulting in many sales. She is now seeking a loan to buy more ingredients for the food she prepares so the business can continue.

In this way she will have the opportunity to provide a good standard of living to her family and better opportunities for economic advancement. Her four children will also be able to access better educational opportunities and, in the future, a university education.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the food she makes

loans.name: Ajak

texts.en:
Ajak lives in bor. She sells at a food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 25 years old, married, and has two children; all of them are still in school. 

Ajak heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans, rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice for sale.

loans.name: Ding

texts.en:
Ding lives in bor. She sells clothes, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children; two of them are still in school. 

Ding heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1200 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Ajah

texts.en:
Ajah lives in bor. She sells at a food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 28 years old, married, and has two children; all of them are still in school. 

Ajah heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans, sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar for sale.

loans.name: Bilquis Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Bilquis bibi is 55 years old and married with four children: three sons and one daughter. Her elder son is married and has two kids. He is a painter by profession and paints on walls and doors and houses on contract. He gets the amount after finishing the contract. Her second son involves in vegetable sales business while her younger son reads in 6th standard. Her daughter stays at home and manages the household works. 
Bilquis herself is involved in animal sales business. Her work is home based. She raises young animals and sells to the required customers. Her work earns her good income which she utilizes to pay off the utilities. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her animal sales business. She will invest the loan in buying of (buffalo) for selling.  
She is sure that her business will return her good profits after investing the loan into it.

loans.use: To buy buffalo for selling

loans.name: Nyiel

texts.en:
Nyiel lives in bor. She sells clothes, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children; three of them are still in school. 

Nyiel heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1200 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Hamidan Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Hamidan bibi is 48 years old married woman and by this relationship she has five children: three sons and two daughters. Her husband and elder son are loaders from profession. They provide their services of loading to their customers. They have their donkey carts on which they load the goods and deliver to their designated places.  
Her second son does private job in a restaurant on monthly wage while her youngest son is free and don’t do anything. Her elder daughter reads in 10th standard and her younger daughter is also free and don’t do anything. 
Hamidan is a housewife, spends her time at home and manages the household works. She makes the utmost efforts to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 
She has requested for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s loading business. With the loan, he will buy a new donkey cart because his current cart has become rough and doesn’t allow him to load heavy items on it which resulted affecting his work. 
She is hopeful that the new donkey cart will allow her husband providing best services to his customers and increasing his profits.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for loading business

loans.name: Khursheed Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed bibi is a widow, and a mother of six children: four sons and two daughters. Her elder son is a loader and used his donkey cart to deliver the goods to the designated places. Her second son operates a scrap business and next to him is a driver from profession while her fourth son is free and don't do anything.  
Her daughters stay at home and help Khursheed by managing the household works. They all are very supportive towards each other. Khursheed grew up her children with great care after the death of her husband. She never lost hope and works hard. Her family respects her and loves her a lot for her efforts and dedication towards their selves. 
Khursheed has requested for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s scrap business. He will invest the loan in buying of scrap like plastic bottles, used papers and wooden & iron items for reselling. 
She is hopeful that her son will get better financial results from his business after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy scrap for selling

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
Ramona es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de 5 hijos a quienes siempre les ha querido ofrecer una buena calidad de vida. Gracias al conocimiento que le dio su madre, Ramona aprendió la preparación de comidas rápidas, y en el momento en que el padre de sus hijos los abandonó sin dejar alguna contribución económica, Ramona lo utilizó para generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Ramona actualmente trabaja preparando las comidas rápidas en un carro donde puede tener la comodidad para hacerlo y cuando tiene mucho trabajo el mayor de sus hijos le colabora para poder atender a todos sus clientes. Gracias al buen servicio que Ramona ofrece ha logrado captar un gran número de clientes fijos para su negocio, lo que le ha permitido tener muy buenas ventas y seguir progresando junto con sus hijos. Con el ánimo de seguir trabajando en su negocio para poder seguirles ofreciendo a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida, Ramona busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de insumos que requiere para la preparación de sus comidas.

Ramona espera que de esta manera pueda seguir trabajando en su negocio y pueda seguir teniendo la única fuente de ingresos que posee para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar y sacar sus hijos adelante.
texts.en:
Ramona is a single mother and head of household with five children whom she always has wanted to give a good quality of life.  Thanks to the knowledge her mother gave her, Ramona learned to prepare fast food.  When the father of her children abandoned them without any financial contribution, Ramona used the knowledge to generate the necessary income to support her household.

Currently Ramona works preparing fast food in a cart where she has the comfort to do it.  When she has a lot of work, the oldest of her children helps her attend to all her customers.  Thanks to Ramona's good service, she has managed to attract a large number of steady customers for her business, which has allowed her to have very good sales and continue making progress with her children.

With the intention of continuing to work in her business to be able to continue giving her children a good quality of life, Ramona is looking for a loan that gives her the opportunity to buy supplies she needs to prepare her dishes.

Ramona hopes that in this way she can continue to work in her business and have the only source of income she has to be able to support the household expenses and get her children ahead.

loans.use: to buy ingredients she needs to make her food.

loans.name: Luz Marleny

texts.es:
Luz Marleny se encuentra casada y tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 17 años de edad, y debido a que los ingresos que genera su esposo no son suficientes para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar, decidió montar su propio negocio en el cual ofrece productos de papelería, productos de uso personal y prendas de vestir, y gracias a esto genera ingresos con los cuales contribuye económicamente para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Luz Marleny siempre ha querido poder ofrecerle a su familia una buena calidad de vida, y trabajando en su negocio lo ha conseguido. Su negocio ha tenido muy buena acogida por parte de sus clientes, por lo que espera seguir creciendo y seguir vendiendo buenos productos. Dado que las prendas de vestir son el producto que más compran sus clientes, Luz Marleny quiere surtir su negocio con este producto, es por esto que busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de prendas de vestir para surtir su negocio con el producto que más compran sus clientes.

De esta manera Luz Marleny podrá tener un gran negocio ofreciendo a sus clientes los productos que ellos requieren. Además, espera que si su negocio crece con mayores ingresos su familia pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida y sus 2 hijos el acceso a una educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Luz Marleny is married and has 2 children who are 14 and 17 years of age, and because the income her husband earns is not sufficient to pay the household expenses she decided to open her own business which provides stationery products, personal care products and clothing, and thanks to this she generates income which contributes economically for the household expenses.

Luz Marleny always has wanted to be able to offer her family a good quality of life, and working in her business she has succeeded. Her business has been very well received by customers, and so she expects to continue growing and continue selling good products. Since clothing is the most popular item her customers buy, Luz Marleny wants to supply her business with this product, which is why she is searching for a loan to give her the opportunity to indulge in the purchase of clothing to supply her business with the product her clients most want to buy.

This is the way Luz Marleny could have a big business offering her customers the products they need. Furthermore, she hopes that her business grows with higher profits so her family can have a better quality of life and her 2 sons can attend university.

loans.use: to buy clothing in order to supply her business with the most often purchased product

loans.name: Attou

texts.en:
Attou lives in bor. She sells clothes, and has been in business for two years. She is 28 years old, married, and has four children; two of them are still in school. 

Attou heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1200 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Luz Fanny

texts.es:
Luz Fanny es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de su único hijo debido a que se separó del padre de su hijo y este se fue sin aportar alguna contribución económica para el sostenimiento de su hijo. Luz Fanny al ver la necesidad de generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar, decidió montar una tienda general donde ofrece productos de la canasta familiar, dulces, gaseosas, snack, entre otros. La tienda la tiene hace aproximadamente 6 años y gracias a esta ha podido sacar su hijo adelante y ha logrado brindarle a su hijo una buena educación. Debido a que cuando montó su tienda no contaba con mucho capital disponible, Luz Fanny no cuenta con un refrigerador en la misma, por lo que busca que un préstamo le permita comprar un refrigerador para ofrecer a sus clientes productos que requieran de estar refrigerados como carnes frías, quesos, entre otros.

De esta manera Luz Fanny espera que su negocio siga saliendo adelante y le permita tener buenos ingresos para no tener que sufrir por la falta de dinero. Además, aspira a que su hijo tenga una buena calidad de vida y el acceso a una buena educación. Luz Fanny sueña con tener un negocio grande donde genere empleo para los más necesitados y desde el cual pueda tener una estabilidad económica para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Luz Fanny is a single mother and the head of the family. She is separated from the father of her son; he provides them with no financial support. Seeing the need to earn an income, Luz Fanny decided to open a store where she sells basic items like candy, soft drinks, snacks etc. She's had the store for about six years and has used the income to support her son and provide him with an education. When she started the store she didn't have much capital so couldn't buy a refrigerator. Now she is seeking a loan to buy one so she can offer her customers items that need to be kept cold such as cold cuts, cheese etc.

With this purchase Luz Fanny hopes that her business will continue to thrive and provide her with a good income so that she doesn't have to worry about money. As well she hopes that her son will have a good standard of living and access to a good education. Her dream is to have a big store and provide employment for those who most need it, and to have a stable, regular income.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator so she can offer her customers items like cold cuts, cheese etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to supply her business with more types of liquor in order to offer a greater variety of products to her clients and thus increase sales

loans.name: Gune

texts.en:
Gune lives in Kator. She sells at a food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 32 years old, married, and has three children. All of them are still in school.

Gune heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and maize flour. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and maize flour for sale.

loans.name: Nyanthiech

texts.en:
Nyanthiech lives in Bor. She sells at a food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 37 years old, married, and has six children; four of them are still in school. 

Nyanthiech heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Jorge Eliecer

texts.es:
Jorge es una persona muy trabajadora que ha luchado fuertemente con el ánimo de sacara adelante a su esposa y sus 5 hijos. Desde muy temprana edad aprendió la actividad del campo gracias a que consiguió trabajo en unos cultivos cerca de su casa. Desde entonces, Jorge viene trabajando en esta actividad la cual en un principio le permitía tener unos ingresos con los que contribuía económicamente a sus padres para el sostenimiento de su hogar, y posteriormente para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar donde convive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos. En su cultivo se ha caracterizado por ofrecer productos de muy buena calidad y esto le ha permitido tener una gran cantidad de clientes fijos que le permiten tener muy buenas ventas mensuales, y con el ánimo de seguir teniendo sus cultivos Jorge busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de abonos, fungicidas e insecticidas para el sostenimiento de sus cultivos.

De esta manera su negocio podrá seguir siendo de muy buena calidad y seguirá recibiendo buenos ingresos por sus productos. Además, espera que su negocio crezca y se siga consolidando para que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Jorge is a very industrious person who has fought hard to move his wife and five children forward. At a very early age he learned how to farm, thanks to which he obtained work in some of the fields near his house. Since then, Jorge has been working as a farmer which at first enabled him to have an income to contribute financially to his parent’s household and later to pay the expenses of his own home where he lives with his wife and children.

His farm is known for producing high quality products, which has enabled him to have a large number of established customers and very good monthly sales. With the goal of continuing to produce his crops, Jorge is looking to a loan to provide the means of purchasing fertilizer, fungicides and insecticides to maintain his fields.

In this way, he will continue having a high quality business that generates a very good income from his products. As well he hopes that his business will grow and continue consolidating so that his family will have a better quality of life and greater opportunities to succeed economically.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, fungicides and insecticides to maintain his fields.

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar lives in Bor. She sells at a food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 28 years old, married, and has five children; three of them are still in school. 

Yar heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1200 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego trabaja como empleado en una finca cerca de su casa, en la cual su oficio es criar los cerdos de su patrón entre otras cosas. Gracias a que su patrón le deja tener cerdos suyos en el corral, Diego ha venido aprovechando esta oportunidad para obtener unos ingresos extras y poder tener así una mejor calidad de vida. Gracias a estos ingresos de más que recibe Diego, su familia ha tenido la oportunidad de acceder a una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas. El corral donde se crían los cerdos no tiene un techo, y además de esto le hace falta un muro para poder tener una mayor cantidad de cerdos en el corral. Con el ánimo de adecuar este corral de mejor manera e introducir más cerdos suyos, Diego aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a realizar adecuaciones locativas al corral colocando un techo y construyendo un nuevo muro.

De esta manera Diego tendrá más animales suyos en el corral de su patrón y así podrá generar mayores ingresos para su familia a parte de su salario. Con mayores ingresos, su familia podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas de progresar.
texts.en:
Diego works as an employee on a farm that is close to his house.  His job is to raise the pigs that his boss has, among other things.  Diego is thankful that his boss lets him keep his own pigs in the corral.  

Diego has been taking advantage of this situation to get extra income in order to be able to improve his quality of life.  Thanks to these increased earnings that Diego receives his family has had the opportunity to have a better quality of life, and they have had greater financial opportunities.

The corral where he raises the pigs does not have a roof.  Also, it needs a wall in order to be able to have more pigs in the corral.  
With the intention of renovating this corral and improving it, he will put more of his own pigs in it.  Diego wants the loan to make improvements to the corral by placing a roof over it and by building a new wall.

This way Diego will have more animals of his own in his boss’s corral.  This way he will be able to generate greater income, aside from his salary, for his family.  With greater income his family will have a better quality of life and greater financial opportunities to advance.

loans.use: to make improvements to the corral by placing a roof over it and by building a new wall.

loans.name: Isabel De Jesus

texts.es:
Isabel es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y siempre querer ofrecer a su familia una buena calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Isabel tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 5 de ellos los crió siendo madre soltera cabeza de familia, posteriormente se casó y tuvo su otro hijo y de allí en adelante vienen progresando juntos. Mientras era madre soltera cabeza de familia y debía criar sus 5 hijos, pasó por grandes adversidades en su vida teniendo que trabajar en condiciones extremas que hacían que su calidad de vida se deteriorara enormemente. Sin embargo, un día tomó la decisión de montar un taller de confección en su propia casa y desde allí viene trabajando más cómodamente y en un trabajo que si le gusta. En su taller de confección ofrece el servicio de confección a terceros, y gracias a la buena calidad de sus trabajos ha logrado reunir una gran cantidad de clientes. Debido a los grandes pedidos que ha tenido, una de sus máquinas se le ha averiado, por lo que busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de materias primas y arreglar su máquina de coser que tiene descompuesta.

Isabel espera que de esta manera sus ingresos sigan aumentando, pues podrá tener una mejor producción y poder responder a todos los pedidos de sus clientes. Además, Isabel espera que con mayores ingresos su familia pueda gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas.
texts.en:
Isabel is a person who has always been known to be a hard worker and she always wants to give her family a good quality of life and better financial stability. Isabel has 6 children of which 5 of them she raised as a single mother as head of the household, and later she married and had another child and from there they have been progressing together. While she was a single mother and head of family, because she had to raise her 5 children, she went through great adversities in her life having to work in harsh conditions that made her quality of life deteriorate enormously. Nonetheless, one day she made the decision to open a sewing workshop in her own home and from there she has been working more happily in work that she likes. In her workshop she offers services to third parties for resale, and thanks to the good quality of her work she has successfully gained a good client base. Because of the large number of orders that she has, one of the machines has broken-down, and this is why she is searching for a loan to give her the opportunity to be able to buy raw material and to fix her broken sewing machine. 

Isabel hopes that in this way her income will continue increasing, and she can have a larger production and be able to respond to all the orders from her customers. Furthermore, Isabel hopes that with higher income her family can enjoy a better quality of life and more economic opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase raw material and to fix her sewing machine that has broken

loans.name: Akeer

texts.en:
Akeer lives in bor. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 29 year old, married, and has four children, two of whom are still in school. 

Akeer heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase sugar and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Akech

texts.en:
Akech lives in bor. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 38 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom are still in school. 

Akech heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en: Tatyana is married. She owns a retail business, selling clothing at Kosmicheskiy market in Zaporozhye. She has been in this business for 13 years. Low prices and not much competition help Tatyana to succeed.  Having a large variety of goods helps her to attract new and repeat customers. She tracks her expenses and profits well and always knows when she needs to purchase more inventory. Tatyana is asking for a loan to help her purchase a new collection of swimming suits for the coming summer season.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of swimming suits.

loans.name: Aruai

texts.en:
Aruai lives in bor. She sells from a food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 45 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom are still in school. 

Aruai heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Nyandeng

texts.en:
Nyandeng lives in Bor. She sells at a food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children; four of them are still in school. 

Nyandeng heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase wheat flour and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina de 41 años de edad, madre de tres hijos tiene como profesion el ser Ingeniera Agronoma. Actualmente labora para una empresa del estado, desempeñandose en el cargo de Archivo Contable. Junto a su esposo el cual tiene como oficio la soldadura y quien le apoya con los gastos del hogar,han podido alcanzar las metas propuestas. Luz es una mujer muy activa y como objetivo esta la construccion de su casa, motivo por el cual acude a Afodenic ya que con las obligaciones y gastos del hogar aparte con los altos costos de los mismos materiales, su salario no le rinde para llevar a cabo de una vez la obra. Hoy con este siendo su primer ciclo de credito y el cual se siente muy afortunada de pertenecer a la gran familia de kiva, comprara: Laminas de zinc, perlines, puertas de madera, golozos, soldaduras entre otros y asi cambiar el techo de su casa que es su principal inquietud en estos momentos ya que se aproxima el invierno y no quiere que se le pase el agua. Manifiesta que atraves de la misma mejora obtendra mejores condiciones de vida y salud para sus pequeños que es su fin primordial.
texts.en: Luz Marina is 41 years old and the mother of three children.  She is an agriculturist by profession.  She is currently working for a state enterprise and is responsible for Accounting Archives. Her husband is a welder by trade and helps her with the household expenses.  Together they have been able to achieve their goals.  Luz is a very active woman and her goal is the construction of her home. She came to Afodenic because the cost of building materials is high, and after paying her obligations and household expenses, she does not have enough of her salary left to complete the work all at once.  This is her first loan cycle and she feels very fortunate to belong to the great Kiva family.  She will purchase zinc sheets, purlins, wooden doors, screws, solder, and other materials to replace her home’s roof.  This is her main concern right now because winter is approaching and she doesn’t want any water leaking through. Making this home improvement will enable her children to be healthy and have better living conditions, which is her primary goal.

loans.use: to replace her home's roof.

loans.name: Agot

texts.en:
Agot lives in bor. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 36 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom are still in school. 

Agot heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar lives in bor. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for two years. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom are still in school. 

Yar heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase sugar and milk. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and milk to sell.

loans.name: Akon

texts.en:
Akon lives in bor. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom are still in school. 

Akon heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer lives in bor. She sells fish and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom are still in school. 

Amer heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Niaz Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Niaz bibi, age 27 years, is married and the mother of two sons. Both of her sons are too young to attend to school. She offers her services as a seamstress in her community. She sews clothes by receiving orders from her community clients. She does this work on a part time basis, but now her work is in demand, so she is deciding to adopt it as a full time business. 

She is also a very caring lady. She is growing up her children with great care and discipline so they make their parents proud. Her husband is a talented man. He operates a computer repairing shop where he repairs computers and also sells computer accessories. His customers are very satisfied because of his good work and they can trust him. 
 
Niaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will invest the loan in the buying of computer accessories and repairing tools so he will be able to uplift his business and improve his income. She is hopeful that her husband’s business will be established further after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy computer accessories and repairing tools.

loans.name: Adut

texts.en:
Adut lives in bor. She sells fish and has been in business for three years. She is 38 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom are still in school. 

Adut heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Diing

texts.en:
Diing lives in bor. She sells charcoal and has been in business for two years. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are still in school. 

Diing heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

Achol lives in bor. She sells charcoal and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom are still in school. 

Achol heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2,500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en:
Ayen lives in bor. She sells fish and has been in business for three years. She is 35 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom are still in school. 

Ayen heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Nyanluak

texts.en:
Nyanluak lives in bor. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 35 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom are still in school. 

Nyanluak heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2,500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase wheat flour and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Angeth

texts.en:
Angeth lives in bor. She sells charcoal and has been in business for three years. She is 28 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom are still in school. 

Angeth heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2,500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer lives in bor. She sells fish and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom are still in school. 

Amer heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Wilson De Jesus

texts.es:
Wilson es una persona muy trabajadora que ha logrado superar grandes dificultades que le ha presentado la vida. Casado y con 2 hijos de 5 y 10 años de edad, Wilson se vio en la obligación de abandonar su municipio natal debido a las pocas oportunidades que encontraba para generar los ingresos que requería para sostener su hogar. Fue así como se desplazó hasta el municipio de Medellín junto con su familia y allí con gran esfuerzo empezó a estudiar diferentes posibilidades de negocio para comenzar a generar sus ingresos. Luego de pensar en muchas alternativas surgió la idea de tener un puesto de venta de papas y platanitos fritos; además encontró un lugar donde es muy concurrido tanto por estudiantes como por comerciantes de la zona, lo que hizo que se volviera muy atractiva la idea. Wilson ya lleva algunos meses con su negocio montado y este ha venido creciendo mucho gracias al esfuerzo que hace por posicionarlo y ofrecer a sus clientes un buen servicio. Y gracias a este esfuerzo que ha hecho, Wilson busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de un carro para preparar fritos para generar un empleo en su negocio, ya que la demanda de sus productos es superior a la capacidad que tiene Wilson para atenderla. 

De esta manera su negocio seguirá creciendo y Wilson podrá tener mayores ingresos para su hogar, de tal manera que su familia podrá gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y poco a poco irá cumpliendo su sueño de sacar sus 2 hijos adelante brindándoles una buena educación.
texts.en:
Wilson is a very hardworking person who has succeeded in overcoming the great difficulties he has encountered in life. He is married with two children, 5 and 10 years old. Wilson found he had to abandon the town where he was born due to scarce job opportunities to support his family. Thus, he, together with his family, moved to Medellín. Through a lot of effort, he began studying different business possibilities for earning a living. After considering many alternatives the idea of having a stall selling fried potatoes and plantains emerged. He found a place that was much frequented both by students and local merchants, which made the idea very attractive.

Wilson has now had his business set up for several months and it has been growing steadily thanks to the work he has done in positioning it and providing his customers good service. Thanks to these efforts, he is now  looking for a loan that will provide the means of purchasing another cart to prepare fried food and to hire an employee, since the demand for his products is greater than he is able to meet on his own.

In this way his business will continue growing and Wilson will be able to earn more income for his home. Consequently his family will be able to enjoy a better quality of life and he will slowly be able to fulfill his dream of moving his children forward by providing them a good education.

loans.use: to purchase a cart to prepare fried food and to hire an employee for his business, since the demand for his products is greater than he is able to meet on his own.

loans.name: Aluel

texts.en:
Aluel lives in Dokuru bor. She sells food at a stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 40 years old, married, and has five children: three of them are still in school. 

Aluel heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Guet

texts.en:
Guet lives in bor. She sells fish and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom are still in school. 

Guet heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Akuany

texts.en:
Akuany lives in bor. She sells charcoal and has been in business for two years. She is 40 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom are still in school. 

Akuany heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Munawar's Group

texts.en:
Munawar is a widow. She lost her husband a few years ago as a result of sudden death. She is a mother of one son who is too young to attend school. To afford their living expenses, Munawar operates a clothes sales business. She sells clothes to her community clients for a profit. Her clothes collection is in great demand among her customers. 

After the death of her husband, she shifted to her brother’s home. She didn’t want to become a burden on her brother, and that’s why she started this business. Her brother runs a small restaurant in the community market. Munawar also helps him by preparing food for his restaurant. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her clothes sales business. She will invest the loan in buying clothes in larger quantities of a better quality for selling. She is hopeful that her business will be improved a lot after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy clothes for her clothes sales business.

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar lives in bor. She sells charcoal and has been in business for two years. She is 32 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom are still in school. 

Yar heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Antonio Jose

texts.es:
Antonio tiene un taller de fabricación y reparación de calzado con el cual genera los ingresos para su hogar donde convive con su esposa y su hijo de 4 años. Antonio anteriormente trabajaba como jornalero, pero se cansó de este trabajo y la mala remuneración que tenía y desde allí montó su taller de fabricación y reparación de calzado. Gracias a los buenos productos que tiene, Antonio ha logrado captar un gran número de clientes, lo que le ha permitido tener muy buenas ventas y progresar rápidamente con su taller. Debido a que actualmente tiene muy baja capacidad de producción comparada con la demanda que hay en el mercado por sus productos, Antonio busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de una máquina industrial para la fabricación del calzado y así aumentar su capacidad de producción y poder responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.

Antonio de esta manera podrá responder a todos los pedidos de sus clientes y así tendrá unos mejores ingresos para su hogar. Además, Antonio espera que con mayores ingresos su familia pueda gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y su hijo de 4 años el acceso a una educación de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Antonio has a workshop where he makes and repairs shoes. This business generates an income for his family; he lives with his wife and their four-year-old. Antonio used to work as a day labourer, but he got tired of the work and the bad pay, so he opened his workshop. Thanks to the good results he has obtained, Antonio has been able to capture a large customer base which has provided him with very good sales. His business has developed rapidly. Because his production capacity is currently very low compared to the market demand for his products, Antonio needs a loan in order to buy an industrial machine for making shoes; this will increase his production capacity and allow him to fill his customers' orders.
This will allow Antonio to respond to all of his customers' orders, and he will therefore have more income for his household. Furthermore, Antonio hopes that this additional income will allow his family to enjoy a better quality of life, and allow his four-year-old to access a higher quality education.

loans.use: to buy an industrial machine for making shoes in order to increase production capacity to respond to orders.

loans.name: Jessenia

texts.es: Jessenia, de 23 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas ganas de superación. Es conviviente con Michel quien es comerciante y padre de su hijo Moisés de 3 años de edad.  Vive en compañía de su pareja e hijos, habitando cómodamente la casa de su propiedad que logró comprar con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Jessenia es la preparación y venta de dulces como tortas y kekes que aprendió a preparar gracias a las enseñanzas de su madre, elaborando unos deliciosos kekes, rosquillas, pancitos y otros, para luego venderlos desde su casa y de forma ambulante. Comenzó con un préstamo particular y ahorros de su pareja para preparar y vender sus dulces, teniendo éste negocio  desde hace más 7 años. Asimismo vende frutas, pero por las constantes lluvias lo ha dejado momentáneamente para luego retomarlo. Le agrada su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico para solventar la manutención de sus hijos, además de tener una ocupación ya que no tuvo la oportunidad de terminar sus estudios. Ahora desea invertir su capital y abrir una pequeña bodega de abarrotes en su casa. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por la oportunidad brindada de tener una línea de crédito para alcanzar sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a la mayoría de sus miembros y los considera ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de dulces como azúcar, aceite, harina, almidón, mantequilla y otros a precio por mayor para así tener mejores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Jessenia, age 23, is a hardworking woman who has tremendous desire to succeed. She is in a common-law relationship with Michel, who is a merchant and the father of their three-year-old son Moisés. Jessenia lives comfortably with her partner and child in their own home which they purchased through much effort. Her business involves preparing and selling sweets such as cakes and cupcakes. She learned how to prepare these treats from her mother. Jessenia makes delicious cupcakes, donuts, sweet rolls, and other items to sell from her home and as a traveling merchant. She utilized a personal loan and her partner's savings to begin preparing and selling sweets. Her business has been in existence for more than seven years. In addition, Jessenia sells fruits, but the constant rains have halted her momentarily, so she will resume this activity later. She is grateful that her business allows her to earn an income for supporting her children and that she has a career since she did not have the opportunity to finish her studies. Now she wants to invest her capital and open a small grocery store in her home.

This will be her second loan with the MFP organization. She is grateful to have the opportunity to access a line of credit for accomplishing her goals. In addition, Jessenia says that she feels comfortable with her Communal Bank because she knows most of the members and considers them to be responsible and supportive people. With the loan of 1,500 PEN that she requested, Jessenia will invest in the purchase of ingredients for preparing sweets such as sugar, oil, flour, starch, butter, and other items in bulk so that she will have better profit margins.

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, flour, starch, and butter.

loans.name: Consorcia

texts.en:
Consorcia is from the village of Capatan. She lives with her spouse and four children. The family operates a business making and selling cacao balls and peanut butters ideal for sandwich spreads. The couple owns an oven used in making/cooking cacao balls and peanut butter. From their income, they have also purchased a motorcycle for transporting their products. They have been involved in this line of business for five years and usually earn about P20,000 each month. She is now asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy sugars, cooking oil, cacao balls, and peanut butter to sell and plastic jars used in packaging.

She hopes to earn consistent profits from the business and keep earning funds to invest in another source of income, like backyard hog-raising. Consorcia would like to become a successful entrepreneur in order to surpass poverty in life.

loans.use: to buy sugars, cooking oil, cacao balls, and peanut butter to sell and plastic jars used in packaging.

loans.name: Map

texts.en:
Map is 38 years old and her husband Vandoeun is 46 years old.  They live in a village about 25 kilometers from the city of Phnom Penh and have four daughters - three attend school and another one is still young. 

Map and her husband are rice farmers. In addition to this, her husband is a fisherman and a motor taxi driver. Map is asking for a loan in the amount of $300 to buy fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

Photo: Map is pictured at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Asmahan

texts.en:
Asmahan is a 42-year-old married woman, and a mother of three sons and three daughters.  Her husband is a worker who earns a low salary which is not enough to cover the family's needs and costs.

For the past seven years, Asmahan has been operating a grocery store, which has been a profitable project for the family.

Asmahan is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing necessary groceries that customers usually request, such as flour, milk, rice, etc. This will help to increase sales and improve the family's income.

Asmahan and her husband appear in the picture, which was taken in her grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase necessary groceries to sell in her grocery store

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is married with four children. All of her children are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education.  

To afford the family's living expenses and to pay her children's school fees, Shazia helps her husband in generating the income. She makes and sells samosas and pakodas (made with graham flour and flour). She sells her products to her community clients. She makes good earnings from her business. Her products are very well-known among local children.

Shazia’s husband operates a car oil sales business. He supplies the oil to different motor workshops and earns profits from it. He has been operating this business for more than 10 years.

Shazia has requested for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy oil in larger quantities to resell. She is hopeful about the positive financial growth of her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy car oil to sell

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.es:
Yamileth se vio en la obligación de abandonar su municipio natal desde hace un largo tiempo en busca de mejores oportunidades laborales y mayores oportunidades económicas para ella y su familia. Yamileth se encuentra casada y tiene 4 hijos a quienes les ha querido ofrecer una buena calidad de vida. Con la necesidad de generar ingresos para contribuir en su hogar, Yamileth aprendió de su hermano la actividad de la compra de excedentes industriales de tela para venderlos en pequeñas cantidades a sus clientes, y de esta manera pudo montar su propio negocio para tener unos ingresos en su hogar. El negocio desde el momento en que lo han montado ha crecido mucho, y ahora su esposo le colabora en este para poder atender todos sus clientes. Con el ánimo de seguir ofreciendo buenos productos a sus clientes, Yamileth busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de excedentes industriales de tela para venderlos a sus clientes en pequeñas cantidades.

De esta manera, Yamileth podrá tener mayores ingresos para su hogar y podrá seguir obteniendo una buena calidad de vida para ella y su familia. Además, Yamileth espera que su negocio le cumpla el sueño de tener su casa propia y dejar de pagar los altos costos del arriendo.
texts.en:
Yamileth felt obligated to leave her hometown. For quite some time, she had been looking for better financial and work opportunities for herself and her family. Yamileth is married and has four children for whom she wants to offer a better quality of life. Since she needed to generate household income, Yamileth learned from her brother the business of buying industrial surplus fabrics that she can sell in small quantities to her customers. This enabled her to establish her own enterprise by which she could generate some income for her household. From the moment it started, her business has grown tremendously. Now her husband helps her by attending to all of her customers. Yamileth is excited about continuing to offer good products to her customers.

She is looking to access a loan so that she can buy industrial surplus fabrics to sell to her customers in small quantities. This will help Yamileth to generate more household income so that she can continue to provide a good quality of life for herself and her family. In addition, she hopes that her business will help her fulfill her dream of having a house of her own since the cost of rent is high.

loans.use: to buy industrial surplus fabrics that she can resell in smaller quantities.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is married and a mother of 8 children. Six of her children are getting an education at a nearby school while her remaining two work with their father in his shoe-making business.

Naseem's husband is very expert in his work and has been doing it for more than 15 years. He makes shoes to order and earns income for the family. Due to the quality of his work and its on-time completion, he has built a good image with his customers which helps him in getting orders every month. 

Naseem has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will invest the loan in buying required material like leather, nails, shoelaces and shoe polish in larger quantities to make shoes to order and earn a better income. She is very confident that her husband’s business will be improved a lot after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy materials needed for a shoe-making business

loans.name: Sanaria's Group

texts.en:
Sanaria is a 27-year-old Iraqi woman.  She is engaged and will be married soon.

Living with her family, she wanted to start making use of her sewing skills, so two years ago she began to work on custom made dresses. She would like to be able to do more, offer more choices to her customers, and work more. 

To improve her small sewing business, Sanaria took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq to buy a new sewing machine, an overlock sewing machine and make small improvements to her work area. 

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers group loans for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine, an overlock sewing machine and make small improvements to her work area

loans.name: Kaneez's Group

texts.en:
Kaneez is a housewife who spends her time staying at home and doing her household responsibilities. She is a mother of 5 children, 3 of whom study; the other 2 work to contribute financially to the family.
