Arbey has always characterized himself as a very hard worker and one who wants to offer his family a good quality of life.  For this reason he always looks for better income and better opportunities for progress for his wife and their four children.  Previously Arbey worked as an employee on a farm where they raised some crops.  From there he began to learn the activity of agriculture; later he studied some agricultural techniques and that is how he began to cultivate sporadically from his home some vegetable crops.  Upon seeing that his home grown crops were growing and that he could sell them at a good price to his clients he decided to grow more and now he has a large crop of vegetables with which he generates income for his home and thus is able to offer a better quality of life to his family.  Thanks to the good quality of his products, Arbey has been able to capture a large number of clients who make large requests, and that is why he is asking for a loan that will permit him to purchase fertilizer, seeds and hoses for his crops so that he can continue responding to the great demands that his customers are making.

In this way his business will continue to grow and thus his family will be able to enjoy a better quality of life.  In addition, Arbey dreams that once his business is consolidated and he is well known in his area, he can then bring to his children greater economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds and hoses for his crops so that he can continue responding to the large requests that his customers are making.

loans.name: Vong

texts.en:
From the Baray district in Kompong Tom province, Vong (42) operates a fish business, earning approximately USD 2.50 per day to meet her daily needs. Her husband is a fisherman who supports her with the fish he catches from the nearby river. Vong has been engaged in the business for nearly seven years. She has three children, one of whom is married and lives separately. 

She will use the loan to purchase new fishing supplies, which will enable her husband to catch more fish. In the future, she hopes that she is able to further improve her business and ensure a comfortable living for her family. She very much appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing supplies for her husband.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira is 55 years old and is married with two children. She sells different kinds of products at her shop in the market. At the moment this picture was taken, she was moving her stock to a new location that she rents at the central bazaar. Elmira has 10 years of experience in her field and her son helps her to sell products. Elmira is a very polite and friendly women and her customers love her. She earns 300 AZN each month. 

Elmira is requesting a 600 AZN loan to increase the number of popular products she sells such as macaroni, sugar, salt, beverages, rice, and ice cream. This will be her third loan and she has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Wilmer Omar

texts.es: Wilmer tiene 27 años de edad, es casado y no tiene hijos, su esposa realiza los oficios domésticos del hogar, es una familia unida y trabajadora. Wilmer se dedica al cultivo y venta de café, el aprendió a cultivar café trabajando con su padre, siempre noto que era muy rentable por lo que decidió iniciar con su propia finca para cultivar café, lo hace desde hace 4 años, trabaja diariamente desde las  5:00 am a 2:00 pm. Una de las ventajas que tiene Wilmer es que le pagan a buen precio el producto. Una de sus desventajas es que tiene que fertilizar el cultivo de café por la plaga que le puede dañar la producción. El préstamo que Wilmer esta solicitando lo necesita para invertirlo en sembrar mas café y comprar fertilizantes, con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá tener una mejor producción de café ya que su finca estará en mejores condiciones por la aplicación de los fertilizantes. Su meta es tener mejor tecnificada su finca y que esta le genere mayores ganancias, para poder mejorar su casa para cuando tengan hijos. Es su primer ciclo en FAMA y espera cancelar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Wilmer is twenty-seven years old and married with no children. His wife works in the home. The family is close-knit and hardworking. Wilmer makes his living cultivating and selling coffee. He learned to grow coffee working with his father. He always noticed that it was very profitable and so decided to start his own plantation and did so four years ago. He works daily from 5:00 am to 2:00 pm. 

One Wilmer's advantages is that he is paid well for the product. One of his disadvantages is that he has to fertilize the coffee crop to protect it from pests that can damage it. Wilmer  intends to invest the loan he is requesting in planting more coffee and buying fertilizers. With the help of this loan he will be able to improve production of coffee since his plantation will be in better condition for the application of the fertilizers. His goal is to introduce the use of modern technology to his plantation and in this way to generate more income. With this, he will be able to improve his house for when he has children. This is his first loan cycle with FAMA and he hopes to repay his loan punctually.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Don Miguel, tiene 59 años de edad, se dedica a la sastrería, específicamente la elaboración de pants y pantalones de lona, cuenta con una experiencia de 20 años, con los ingresos de su trabajo ha logrado sostener a su familia. Solicita un préstamo que le servirá para ampliar su capital de trabajo y que lo utilizará para compra de materiales como telas de lona e hilos, para poder producir mas pants de los que actualmente esta trabajando, espera con el préstamo que hace a ASDIR, logre el objetivo de mejorar su producción y su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Miguel is 59 years old and works as a tailor, making slacks and canvas pants. He has 20 years experience. With the profits from his work he supports his family. 

He is asking for a loan in order to increase his work capital and will use it to buy materials such as canvas and thread in order to be able to produce more pants than he can at the moment. He hopes that with the loan from ASDIR he will reach his goal of improving his production and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials for making clothes

loans.name: Mirian Del Carmen

texts.es: Mirian es soltera. Tiene 40 años y nació en Chaguarpamba. Chaguarpamba es un recinto que pertenece a la ciudad de Machala. Desde que nació a vivido ahí y se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos. Tiene 2 hijos: Miriam y Ulises ambos mayores de edad. Empezó su negocio por iniciativa de una amiga quien le indico sus beneficios. Como vive en una pequeña quinta tiene mucho espacio y con esfuerzo adquirió los pollos y empezó la crianza. Actualmente su negocio ha prosperado y vende aproximadamente 500 pollos al mes. Su mayor preocupación es enfermarse ya que los animales necesitan de cuidado y ella trabaja sola. Este es su primer préstamo y desea comprar más pollos para incrementar su negocio. Su meta es crear una pequeña empresa de venta de productos avícolas.
texts.en: Mirian is single.  She is 40 years old and was born in Chaguarpamba.  Chaguarpamba is a precinct that belongs to the city of Machala.  She has lived there since she was born and she works in household labor.  She has two children: Miriam and Ulises, both of whom are adults.  She began her business through the initiative of a friend who recommended its benefits.  Because she lives in a rural area she has a lot of space and with effort she acquired some chickens and began to raise them.  Currently her business has prospered and she sells approximately 500 chickens per month.  Her greatest concern is getting sick since the animals need care and she works alone.  This is her first loan and she wants to buy more chickens in order to grow her business.  Her goal is to create a small business selling agricultural products.

loans.use: To purchase chickens

loans.name: Buth Kanha

texts.en:
Buth Kanha is 26 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. For the past two years, she has been selling fried bananas and she earns approximately 2 USD per day. Her husband is employed at a timber factory and earns about 6 USD each day. In order to improve her family’s economy, Buth Kanha wants to start an additional business. 

Buth Kanha is requesting a 500 USD loan to start a cassava cultivation business. In the future, she would like to use her profit to expand her business and help her children get their bachelors degrees. Buth Kanha also hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to cultivate cassava

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong is 33 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. Kong and his wife have been involved in agriculture for over ten years and they are successful in their careers since they have extensive experience growing crops and raising cattle. They earn approximately 8 USD daily.

Kong is requesting a 400 USD loan to rent farmland to cultivate more crops. This will help generate more income to support his family. In the future, Kong would like to expand his business and help his children obtain their bachelors degrees. He also plans to rebuild his house to make it bigger and more comfortable for his family.

loans.use: to rent farmland to cultivate crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy foods at wholesale.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos tiene 33 años de edad, es casado, tiene 4 hijos, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a cuidar a sus hijos. Desde hace 12 años se dedica al cultivo y venta de café, aprendió del oficio de su padre ya que trabajaba desde niño, le gusto el negocio y ahora tiene su propia finca, el horario de trabajo es de 5:00 am a 2:00 pm y cuando es la temporada de cosecha de café es a tiempo completo, no tiene horario de entrada y salida porque el trabajo es abundante. Carlos solicita este préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, ya que lo necesita para el mejoramiento de la finca para poder obtener una buena cosecha. El préstamo le ayudaría en gran manera ya que anteriormente tenía que comprometer la cosecha con intermediarios los cuales le pagan el café a un bajo precio, aprovechándose de que necesita el dinero para la cosecha. Uno de los sueños de Carlos es tener una mejor producción de café y así obtener mayores ventas. Este es su primer préstamo en FAMA y espera cumplir puntualmente con el compromiso de sus pagos.
texts.en:
Carlos is 33 years old, married and has 4 children. His wife does household tasks and cares for the children. Carlos has been a coffee farmer and seller for 12 years. He learned the job from his father with whom he worked since he was a child. He enjoys the business and now owns his own plantation. His work schedule is from 5 a.m. to 2 p.m., however during coffee harvest season, he works full time and does not follow a particular schedule since there is so much work to do. 

Carlos is applying for this loan in order to purchase fertilizer because he needs it to improve his land so that it will yield a good harvest. The loan would help greatly since previously he had to pledge his coffee to intermediaries beforehand, who paid him a lower price and took advantage of his need for money before the harvest. One of his dreams is to produce more coffee and thus generate higher sales. This is his first loan with FAMA and he expects to make all of his payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Florcita Judith

texts.es: Florcita tiene 40 años, nació en Jipijapa recinto de Manabí. Está casada con Manuel Loor y tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 8 años. Como su esposo es obrero y vive en Guayaquil dejo su tierra natal. Hace 8 años empezaron la construcción de su casa la cual no han podido terminar por la falta de recursos económicos. Se decidió a empezar el negocio por la necesidad ya que no tenía trabajo. En sus inicios vendía en su casa confitería, snack y colas pero pasando los años el negocio prospero. Hoy en día ya no vende en la sala de su casa tiene un local compro una copiadora e inicio su bazar. Nos comenta que tiene un horario de 6 am hasta las 10 pm, es cansado pero le permite estar con sus hijos quienes asisten a la escuela.  Como su esposo es obrero ella atiende el negocio sola, esto la preocupa ya que se vuelve vulnerable a la delincuencia. El préstamo lo va a utilizar comprando artículos de bazar, papelería y confitería para aumentar su negocio. Su sueño es incrementar sus ventas de tal manera que sus ingresos le permitan terminar su casa.
texts.en: Florcita is 40 years old.  She was born in Jipijapa, a precinct of Manabí.  She is married to Manuel Loor and has two children ages 5 and 8.  Since her husband is a factory worker and lives in Guayaquil she left her native land.  8 years ago they began construction of their house, which they have not been able to complete for lack of economic means.  She decided to begin her business out of necessity since she did not have work.  At the beginning she sold candy, snacks and sodas, but over the years her business prospered.  Today she no longer sells from the living room of her home.  She has a shop, purchased a copier and started her bazaar.  She tells us that she has a schedule from 6am to 10pm, and that she is tired but it allows her to be with her children who attend school.  As her husband is a factory worker she works alone.  This worries her since she has become vulnerable to delinquency.  The loan will be used to purchase products for the store, like stationary and candies to increase business.  Her dream is to increase sales so that her income will allow her to finish constructing her home.

loans.use: to purchase products for the store, like stationary and art products and candies

loans.name: Tes

texts.en:
Tes is 35 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. For the past 10 years, Tes and her husband have been working at a rubber plantation, earning approximately 7 USD per day. 

Tes is requesting a 400 USD loan to improve her family’s economy and purchase farmland to grow crops. Her loan will help her start a new business and earn extra income to support her family. In the future, Tes would like to expand her business and help her children get their bachelors degrees. She also hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to cultivate crops

loans.name: Tat

texts.en:
Tat, 46, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been running food store for more than two years, earning approximately USD 10 per day. Her husband is involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up animals. He earns approximately USD 3 per day. All of her children are still in her care. 

In order to improve her family’s economy, Tat is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase plates, bowls, chairs and tables to use in her food store. This money will help her get enough equipments to use in her business and earn more profit. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: buy plates, bowls, chairs and tables for her food store

loans.name: Ruqqiya's Group

texts.en:
Ruqqiya sells milk. For that purpose, she has a buffalo at her home. She gets up early in the morning, milks the buffalo and sells that milk to her community clients. She has a good number of clients from her community because she sells good quality fresh milk at very reasonable prices. Milk selling is her family business and she operates it with her husband.  Her husband also sells animal feed to his clients.
  
Ruqqiya has given birth to 5 sons and a daughter. Her second son works and the remaining ones are getting their education. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her business. With this loan investment, she will buy another buffalo to get a larger quantity of milk for selling.  She is very confident that her family business will grow after investing the loan and it will help her family to live a better financial life.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy, 22, is married and resides with her mother, her husband and two children in Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She has been selling porridge and fried noodles for more than ten years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about USD 3 per day. 

Because of her number of customers is increasing, Channy is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase more tables and chairs to expand her store. This money will help her provide enough space for her customers and earn more income to support her family. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new concrete house as soon as possible.

loans.use: buy tables and chairs to expand her food stall

loans.name: Elsa Maria

texts.es: Elsa tiene 64 años y está casada con Jorge. Nació en Loja pero como muchos de su ciudad se mudo para conseguir mejores condiciones de vida. En la actualidad vive en La Libertad. Nos cuenta que al principio se le hizo un poco difícil adaptarse ya que Loja es una cuidad fría y La Libertad es muy cálido por ser costa. Ahora en cambio le encanta la playa y está muy a gusto con el clima. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca y ella tiene una tienda. Cuando inicio su negocio en el año 2006 no había tiendas por su sector, ahora muchos vecinos han imitado su iniciativa. La competencia es dura pero a podido seguir progresando. Como sus hijos ya son mayores e independientes ella maneja la tienda pero no se queja porque le permite descansar y cuidar de su salud y esposo. Con el préstamo incrementara su venta de gas, papelería y víveres.
texts.en: Elsa is 64 years old and is married to Jorge.  She was born in Loja but like many from her city she moved in order to find a better quality of life.  Currently she lives in La Libertad.  She tells us that at the beginning it was a bit difficult to adapt since Loja is a cold city and La Libertad is very warm because it is on the coast.  Now, however, she loves the beach and is very happy with the climate.  Her husband works as a fisherman and she has a store.  When she began her business in 2006 there were no stores in her area.  Now many neighbors have imitated her initiative.  The competition is hard but she has been able to continue progressing.  Since her children are older and independent now, she manages the store but she does not complain because it allows her to rest and care for her health and her husband.  With the loan she will increase her sales of cylinders of gas, paper products and foods.

loans.use: to increase sales of cylinders of gas, paper products and foods.

loans.name: Eark

texts.en:
Eark, 22, is married and resides with her mother, her husband and one child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been working on a rubber plantation for more than three years, earning approximately USD 9 per day. 

Eark wants to build a new house. With this goal in mind, Eark is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase timber to construct the house. This money will enable her to provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run her own rubber plantation and help her children get bachelor degrees and get good jobs.

loans.use: buy timber to build her house

loans.name: Veang

texts.en:
Veang, 29, is sigle and resides with her mother in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a timber factory for over three years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Veang would like to run an additional business. Due to lack of funds, Veang requests a loan of USD 500 to purchase a plot of farmland to cultivate cassavas. This money will help her acquire the security to start this new business. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it more convenient for her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: build land to grow cassavas

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy leather, zippers and buttons to make leather jackets

loans.name: Kahlida's Group

texts.en:
Kahlida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her livestock and dairy business. With this loan investment, she will buy another buffalo to get a larger quantity of milk for selling. 

Kahlida is very active and operates this business with her husband.  Both are very hard working and get up early in the morning to start their work. They sell the milk to their community clients and to different milk shops to earn profits. 

Khalida also performs her household duties very well and her family is very happy with her efforts. She has given birth to 3 children. All of them are very young and haven’t started their education yet. She is a very positive thinking lady and is confident that her family business will be improved with the loan investment.

Note: "One of the members has a sewing clothes business, that's why she is showing it in the picture".

loans.use: buy a buffalo for her livestock & dairy business

loans.name: Hul

texts.en:
Hul, age 61, has been a farmer cultivating rice crops for years.  She lives in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She usually works along with her husband to manage the maintenance of the rice field, earning a suitable income to raise their family of six children. She loves doing this type of business since she is a low-educated woman who only finished primary school level. She, together with her husband, has committed to work hard because they want to provide a good education to their children. Presently, five of them are married and have independent lives, living separately around the province, while the remaining one is still a student.

Due to the lack of a vehicle for home use, Hul is experiencing difficulties in using other transportation services. To better her situation, she is asking for a loan of USD 1,300 to purchase a motorcycle to meet the needs of her family. This loan will help her family avoid the expenses of transportation services. In the future, Hul wants to expand her farming business, renovate her house and save money for her last-born child who is studying at university.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle for family use

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her livestock business. With this loan investment, she will buy a buffalo. She will raise it and sell it for profit. She will also sell its milk to her community clients to earn an extra profit.
 
Zubaida is a very hardworking and efficient lady. She does this work to supplement the income for her family. Her husband is also a very hardworking person. He operates a business selling wheat and other agricultural products. He handles a good clientele base and operates this business in the market.  

Zubaida is the mother of 5 sons and a daughter. Her sons do different kind of jobs, while her daughter remains at home and help her in her routine tasks.  Zubaida and her family are very hardworking and make great effort to earn a living. She is confident that her business will improve further by investing the loan in it.

loans.use: buy a buffalo

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Nancy Elena

texts.es:
Nancy es una madre soltera que tuvo que sacar a su hijo adelante por si sola, y gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante ha logrado superar estas adversidades y continuar progresando junto con su hijo. En un principio Nancy tenía un empleo con el cual generaba unos ingresos que a pesar de que no eran en grandes cantidades eran apenas suficientes para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar; sin embargo, al verse en la obligación de estar más atenta al cuidado de su hijo se vio en la obligación de dejar su empleo y así fue que inició su negocio de venta de productos de uso personal, negocio que puede atender desde su propia casa. Nancy ya lleva un largo tiempo desempeñando esta actividad y gracias a la buena atención que ofrece a sus clientes ha logrado captar cada vez más clientes para seguir progresando junto a su familia. Con el ánimo de aumentar su variedad de productos Nancy busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de uso personal y así aumentar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes.

De esta manera Nancy podrá hacer más atractivo su negocio para los clientes, al encontrar una mayor variedad de productos; además, podrá tener mayores ingresos con los cuales tendrá la oportunidad de ofrecer a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Nancy is a single mother who had to raise her child alone. Thanks to her drive to succeed, she was able to overcome adversity and continue progressing with her son. Nancy worked at a low-paying job at first, but the income she earned was not sufficient for maintaining her household expenses. However, she felt obligated to pay more attention to the needs of her son, so she left her job and started a business of selling personal use products. She manages this business from her home.

Nancy took a long time to develop her business. Thanks to the good service that she provide to her customers, she was able to expand her clientele so that she could continue making progress with her family. Nancy is eager to increase the variety of products that she offers, so she is taking this opportunity to access a loan. She will buy personal use products so that she can increase the variety of merchandise that she offers to her customers. This will help make Nancy's business more attractive to her customers since they will have more products from which to choose. As a result, she will generate more income and have the opportunity to provide her son with a better quality of life and greater financial opportunities to make progress.

loans.use: to buy personal use products.

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
Dy is 45 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. For the past three years, she has been running a grocery store and earns 3 USD daily. Her husband is a soldier who earns about 3 USD per day. 

Dy is requesting a 750 USD loan to purchase more grocery items to sell. This will increase her profit and help support her family. In the future Dy would like to expand her business and help her children get their bachelors degrees. She also hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Sophea, 36, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been working as construction workers for more than two years, earning approximately USD 12 per day. Due to the difficulty of her family’s transportation, Sophea is requesting a loan of USD 750 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use money saved on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home to generate extra income to support the family and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Norma Susana

texts.es: Norma nació en Balzar. Tiene 36 años. Está casada y tiene tres hijas. Desde hace 9 años vive en Guayaquil extraña su ciudad natal por la tranquilidad que se siente al vivir en un pueblo pequeño. Su esposo es soldador. Norma empezó la tienda con sus ahorros y la ha incrementado trabajando todos los días. No tiene ningún empleado ya que sus hijas le ayudan. Se siente muy satisfecha porque le permite cuidar a sus hijas y descansar. Este es su tercer préstamo y lo va a utilizar en la compra de arroz, azúcar, granos, pollo etc. para aumentar su tienda.  Sus proyectos futuros es ayudar a sus hijas a terminar la escuela y seguir la universidad
texts.en: Norma was born in Balzar. She is 36 years old. She is married and has three daughters. She has lived for 9 years in Guayaquil and misses the tranquility that she felt living in a little village. Her husband is a welder. Norma began her store with her savings and is now working daily. She does not have any employees but her daughters help her. She feels very satisfied because she can care for her daughters and rest. This is her third loan and she is going to use it to buy rice, sugar, beans, and chicken, and to supply her store. Her future project is to help her daughters finish school and to continue on to university.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, flour and colas

loans.name: Deibin Said

texts.es: Deibin tiene 27 años de edad, es casado y tiene 1 hija, su esposa se dedica a los trabajos de la casa, es una familia muy unida y el trabajo lo realizan en equipo, en algunas ocasiones han tenido problemas de salud y económicos pero siempre lo han podido resolver. Hace varios años que Deibin inicio con su propio negocio, ya que el se dedica a la producción de café, trabajo que aprendió de su padre desde edad muy temprana, el horario de trabajo es variable ya que cuando esta la temporada de producción de café se trabaja a tiempo completo, no hay hora de entrada ni de salida porque el trabajo es abundante. El préstamo que Deibin esta solicitando lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra, seria una muy buena oportunidad ya que de lo contrario tendría que comprometer la cosecha como en años anteriores con intermediarios que se aprovechan a comprar el producto a un bajo precio. Algunos de los problemas que enfrenta Deibin es la falta de trabajadores en la temporada y el mal estado de las calles que atrasa el acarreo del producto. Uno de sus sueños es tener una finca bien fertilizada y con buenas herramientas que faciliten la cosecha. Este es el primer financiamiento que obtiene Deibin en FAMA y espera cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Deibin is twenty-seven years old and married with one daughter. His wife works in the home. The family is very close-knit and works together as a team to accomplish their tasks. On some occasions they have had health and economic problems but have always been able to resolve them. Deibin started his own business several years ago, and has made his living through coffee production since. He learned the trade from his father at a very early age. The work schedule is varied, since during the coffee production season he works full time. There aren't start and stop times because the work is so abundant.

Deibin intends to use the loan he is requesting to buy fertilizers and pay for manual labor. It would be a very good opportunity since without it he would have to pledge the crop, as in previous years, to intermediaries who take advantage of him to buy it at a low price. Some of the problems that Deibin faces are a lack of workers in production season and the bad state of the roads, which delays transport of the product. One of his dreams is to have a well-fertilized plantation with good tools that facilitate the crop. This is the first funding that Debin has received through FAMA and he hopes to make his payments punctually.

loans.use:
COMPRA DE FERTILIZANTES Y PAGO DE MANO DE OBRA
to buy fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en:
Thoeurn is 39 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and five children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. For over 20 years, she has been a farmer and has extensive experience. Thoeurn has been successful in her career growing rice and raising pigs. She earns 3 USD daily. Thoeurn's husband runs a junk business and earns about 4 USD per day. 

Thoeurn is requesting a 900 USD loan to provide capital for her husband's business and purchase junk and materials in larger quantities to resell. Her loan will increase his profit and help improve her family’s livelihood. Thoeurn would like to help her husband expand his business and help her children get their bachelors degrees. She also hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase junk and material for her husband's business

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 33 years old and is married with one child. He is a farmer working in the Philippines and has been growing rice for the past five years. Edgar's wife manages their hog-raising business to provide additional income.

Edgar is requesting a loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and rice seedlings. He hopes to increase his profits so that he can sustain the financial needs of his family, improve their standard of living, and save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and rice seedlings

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Pech is 57 years. She is widowed and lives with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in animal husbandry for more than six years and she earns approximately 2 USD per day. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory and earn about 4 USD per day. 

Pech is requesting a 500 USD loan to improve her business and purchase piglets to breed and resell. This money will help her expand her business and increase her profit to support her family. In the future, Pech would like to use her profit to expand her business and help her children get their bachelors degrees. She also hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to breed and resell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a farmer who raises his family in a village. He is 45 years old and has five school-age children. He aims to educate all his children so that they will find a good job someday. 

Despite financial difficulty, he has the confidence to pursue his plan.  Daniel cultivates their farm land by planting rice and vegetables for sale. He also engages in hog-raising to generate additional income.

Danel aims to raise more pigs for sale, but he has not enough capital, therefore he is requesting for an additional PHP10,000 to buy feeds, vitamins, additional piglets to raise and materials needed to improve his pig pen. He believes that the loan will help him work out his plan and hopes that he will be successful in the future to give his family a better life.

loans.use: buy feeds, vitamins, piglets, and improve his pig pen

loans.name: Neour

texts.en:
Neour, 56, is widowed and resides with her four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fresh water shells for more than five years, earning approximately USD 6 per day. Two of her children are employed as a construction worker and a motor taxi driver. Approximately, they earn USD 7 per day. 

Neour is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a new motorbike for her son to run his taxi service because his present motorbike is old. This purchase would enable him to attract more customers and earn more income to support the family. In the future, Neour would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for her son's transport business

loans.name: Chan Thea

texts.en:
Chan Thea, 50, is married, resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for more than four years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about USD 4 per day. All of her children are still in her care and in school. Therefore, she needs to spend much on her children’s education expenses. 

In order to encourage her children to study hard, Chan Thea is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a computer for them to use in their study. This purchase would enable her children to get modern tools to use in their study as well as to search for other related documents. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: buy a computer for her children's studies

loans.name: Sothy

texts.en:
Sothy, 47, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband has been running a barber shop for more than ten years, earning approximately USD 3 per day.  Three of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about USD 3 per day. 

Sothy wants to build a family house. With this goal in mind, she is requesting a loan of USD 1500 to purchase construction materials to build the house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store to generate extra income for the family and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: build a house

loans.name: Gilma Marisela

texts.es:
Gilma tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella se dedica a vender enchiladas, enredos, papas fritas, pasteles, charamuscas, chocobananos, etc. en la escuela de su comunidad desde hace dos años. Inicio este negocio por iniciativa propia y aprendió a elaborar productos con su mamá, antes de dedicarse a esta actividad ella solo realizaba los oficios domésticos en su  hogar.

Los productos los compra cada 15 días en una ciudad que esta a dos horas de su casa, para llegar a ese lugar debe caminar a pie unos treinta y cinco minutos desde su casa hasta donde aborda el autobús.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una motocicleta, para su esposo ya que el trabaja como seguridad en una empresa privada, la distancia es aproximadamente de una hora quince minutos. Con la inversión le facilitara el trasporte a su esposo, para que se pueda trasladar más rápido a su lugar de trabajo. 

Gilma desea instalar un negocio de venta de hot dog, ya sea los domingos y por las tardes en la cancha y cuando se realicen fiestas en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Gilma is 28 years old, married, and has two children. She has been selling enchiladas, cassava fritters, French fries, frozen treats, chocolate-covered bananas, and other foods at the school in her community for two years. Gilma started her business through her own initiative and learned how to make these foods from her mother. She previously spent her time solely on her household chores.

Gilma buys her supplies every 15 days in the city, which is a two-hour trip from her house. In order to get there, she must walk approximately 35 minutes before reaching the stop where she boards a bus.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to buy a motorcycle for her husband. He works as a security guard at a private business and it takes him approximately one hour and fifteen minutes to get there. This investment will facilitate access to transportation for her husband, which will help him get to work faster.

Gilma wants to start a hot dog business so that she can sell in the town square on Sundays, in the evenings, and when there are festivals held in her community.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her husband.

loans.name: Srey Oun

texts.en:
Srey Oun, 23, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up cattle for more than four years, earning approximately USD 8 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s economy, Srey Oun is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more farmland for growing agricultural crops. By doing so, she would earn extra income to support her family.  In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and send her children to a good school.  Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family’s living condition.

loans.use: buy farmland to grow crops

loans.name: Nolyn

texts.en:
Due to financial burden, Nolyn did not pursue her studies in college. She decided to help her parents in managing their farm land to earn and save for the future and to support the education of her younger brother and sister.  She is now 21 years old and has the ambition to uplift their poor living condition.  Despite the hardship and difficulties they encounter in farming, she has the determination to increase their production.

Due to insufficient capital, Nolyn is requesting for PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in rice farming. She mentioned that her loan will enable her to work out her plan and hopes that they will be having a fruitful harvest this coming harvest season.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and pesticides for her rice farm

loans.name: Thoung

texts.en:
Thoung is 68 years old and a loving mother of seven children. She lives with her family in the Baray district, Kompong Tom province. Thoung is widowed and she aims to improve her family’s living status and provide them a better life. Thoung engages in three businesses: rice farming, rice selling and raising hogs. She sells her harvest and the harvest of other villagers at a local market of the province. Aside from agriculture, she raises piglets to fatten and sell. In order to manage her many businesses, some of Thoung's children help her. Five of her children are married, and the other two live with their mother.

Thoung is requesting a Kiva loan through HKL to purchase an extra plot of land to increase her rice production. She hopes that she will be able to improve her yields and increase her income in the coming season. Thoung's business goal is to expand her shop and sell larger quantities of rice. This will be her seventh loan from HKL. Thoung is very thankful to lenders who always give her a constant help to develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land to increase her rice production

loans.name: Amna's Group

texts.en:
Amna has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s livestock and dairy business.   With the loan investment, he will buy a buffalo. That will help him in getting a larger quantity of milk for selling to his clients and increase his profits. 

Amna is the mother of 3 children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education.  She is very positive in her thinking and is confident about her family’s better future as a result of her husband’s business improvement.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a farmer who lives in a village. He is a single parent who owns and manages a rice farming business in their community. He aims to improve his rice farming business to earn and save for his and his child's future. He plans to expand his rice plantation and raise livestock to increase his income.  Wilson has been operating his farm for almost 6 years and usually earns a profits of PHP 18,000 every harvest season, which he utilizes for their daily consumption and save for their future.

To increase his production, Wilson is asking for an additional capital of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed for the maintenance of his rice farming business. Through patience and hard work, he believes that he will be able to increase his yields this coming harvest season.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and pesticides for his rice farm

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang, 52, is married and resides with her husband and eight children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in the agricultural business for more than twenty years.  They have extensive experience and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle.  They earn approximately USD 8 per day.  Five of her children are employed as garment workers and construction workers.  They earn about USD 17 per day. 

Heang requested a loan of USD 1500 to pay for her son’s wedding expenses. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: pay for her son's wedding expenses

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es: Marlon tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres, desde hace 10 años se dedica al cultivo del café, trabajo que aprendió de su padre desde que era un niño, después de algún tiempo el  logro independizarse  y comenzo a cultivar su propia finca, el horario de  trabajo es variado cuando es tiempo de la cosecha se trabaja fuerte y no se descansa. Hasta el momento las dificultades que se le han presentado a Marlon es la escasa mano de obra para cosechar el café siendo que todos están realizando el mismo trabajo, otro inconveniente es el traslado del café al punto de venta, siendo que debido al mal estado de las calles, producto por la lluvia de la temporada de  invierno se hace más difícil transportar el producto. El préstamo que Marlon solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes y pago a los trabajadores que realizan el mantenimiento a la finca. El préstamo le ayudaría en gran manera ya que anteriormente tenía que comprometer la cosecha con intermediarios los cuales se aprovechan a pagar el café a un bajo precio. Una de las metas de Marlon es tener una finca bien tecnificada y con herramientas que le puedan agilizar el trabajo. Este es el primer préstamo que obtiene de FAMA y espera cancelar sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Marlon is twenty-four years old and single. He lives with his parents, and for the past ten years has made his living through the cultivation of coffee. He learned this trade from his father when he was a boy. After some time he was able to become independent and began to cultivate his own plantation. The work schedule is varied. During the harvest season one works hard without rest. 

To date, the difficulties that Marlon has faced are the scarcity of manual labor for the coffee harvest, since everyone is doing the same work at the same time. Another inconvenience is the transferral of the coffee to the point of sale, since due to the bad state of the roads—a product of the winter rains—it is difficult to transport the product. 

Marlon intends to use the loan he is requesting to buy fertilizers and pay the workers who maintain the plantation. The loan would help him considerably, since before he had to pledge the crop to intermediaries who would take advantage of him to pay a low price for the coffee. One of Marlon's goals is to introduce modern technology to his plantation and to have the proper tools to expedite the work. This is the first loan that he has received from FRAMA and he hopes to make his payments in a punctual way.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya is a 46-year-old widow and the mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled in a local school getting their education. She is a great mother who is very sensitive about her children. She wants them to complete their education and become successful in life.

To meet her family's financial expenses, she sews clothes for neighboring clients. She is a very hardworking lady who has had a very difficult time in life, particularly after the death of her husband. Now her eldest son also contributes to the family finances with his book selling business. He runs a shop in the market where he sells old and new books, including books for school children's classes.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her eldest son’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy books in larger quantities to sell to his clients in order to earn better profits. Surriya is hopeful that her son will make good use of the loan to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy books to sell.

loans.name: Martin Adan

texts.es:
Martin es una persona muy trabajadora que siempre se ha caracterizado por querer brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar. Martin se encuentra casado y tiene 3 hijos a quienes les ha querido ofrecer el acceso a una buena educación, y es por esto que trabaja fuertemente en su negocio para generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Desde hace aproximadamente 12 años Martin vende dulces, snack, y otros productos de confitería en una choza que le dio el Gobierno y desde la cual ha venido trabajando para generar los ingresos para su hogar. Gracias a este negocio ha podido brindar en su familia una mejor calidad de vida y por esto se siente tan agradecido todos los días. Debido a que su negocio ha venido aumentando sus ventas considerablemente, Martin busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de dulces, snack, y otros productos de confitería para surtir su negocio y ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos.
De esta manera su negocio seguirá creciendo y así seguirán aumentando sus ventas, de modo tal que su familia podrá gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Martin is a hardworking individual who has always been known for wanting to provide his family a good quality of life and better economic opportunities to make progress. He is married and has three children for whom he wants to provide a good education. For this reason, he works hard in his business so that he can generate the necessary income for maintaining the household expenses. For approximately 12 years, Martin has been selling sweets, snacks, and other food products from a trailer that was given to him by the government. This provides him with work by which he is able to generate income for his household. Thanks to this business, he is able to provide his family with a better quality of life. This is why he feels grateful every day.

The sales in his business have increased considerably. Martin is seeking a loan so that he will have the opportunity to purchase sweets, snacks, and other food products in order to restock his business and offer his customers a wider variety of products. His business will continue to grow and increase in its sales. This will give his family the chance to enjoy a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for progress.

loans.use: to buy sweets, snacks, and other food products.

loans.name: Gilberth Jacinto

texts.es: Gilberto  de 40 años vive (paraíso  Ecuador). El comenzó trabajando en empresas como guardia de seguridad luego que se quedo sin empleo decidió comprar un carro y  comenzar a taxiar. Hasta ahora le va bien la dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia. Trabaja todos los días solo. Es casado tiene 2 hijos a futuro el anhela tener su casa . con el préstamo comprar (herramientas, llantas para auto ).
texts.en: Gilberto is 40 years old and lives in Paraíso, Ecuador. He started out working for companies as a security guard. After he became unemployed, he decided to buy a car and begin providing taxi services. It's been going well so far - the one difficulty he faces is crime. He works by himself every day. He's married and has two children. In the future he aspires to own a house of his own. He will use the loan to purchase tools and tires for his car.

loans.use: to purchase tools and tires.

loans.name: Estela Hermelinda

texts.es:
La señora es casada tiene 45 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa, inició este negocio por iniciativa propia y hasta el momento lleva 13 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien la apoya económicamente.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería y así mejorar su ventas, ella quiere comprar playeras, camisa, sueteres, ropa intima, etc. En el futuro espera tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Estela is forty-five years old and married. She had three years of elementary education. She has two children who are currently in school. She makes her living through commerce–specifically the sale of clothing. She started this business by her own initiative and has thirteen years of experience to date. She has the support of her spouse, who supports her economically.

She will use the loan she is requesting to buy merchandise in order to improve her sales. She wants to buy sneakers, blouses, sweaters, undergarments, etc. In the future she hopes to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Juan Pablo tiene 44 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales ninguno estudia, se dedica a la panadería, inició este trabajo siendo operario y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a la venta de comida.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para compra harina, azúcar, huevo, levadura, manteca, etc. Espera en el futuro tener un ben negocio.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Pablo is 44 years old. He completed six years of his elementary school education. Juan Pablo has four children, but none of them are in school. He manages a bakery. Juan Pablo started in this line of work as an operator, and now he has five years of experience. He has the support of his wife, who sells food.

Juan Pablo is requesting a loan so that he can buy flour, sugar, eggs, yeast, butter, and other supplies. He hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making bread.

loans.name: Solidario Don De Dios Group

texts.es: Doña Maria Lucita, es casada tiene 41 años de edad tiene 4 hijos todos estan estudiando ella vende carne de rez y venta de ropa tipica desde hace varios años, ella nos esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa tipica porque sus clientes le piden estilos diferentes y ella no cuenta con el capital suficiente ya que pues tambien desea comprar carne de rez, y asi seguir con su venta.desde ya agradece la ayuda que le puedan brindar.
texts.en: Maria Lucita is forty-one years old and married. She has four children, all of whom are in school. She has sold beef and traditional clothes for many years. She is requesting this loan from us in order to buy traditional clothing because her clients request different styles and she doesn't have sufficient capital to purchase them since she also wants to buy beef and to continue with her sales. She is grateful for whatever support can be provided.

loans.use: Venta de ropa tipica y compra de carne de rez.

loans.name: Angela Agustina

texts.es: Ángela de 55 años vive (fortín Guayaquil). Ella decidió entrar a este negocio porque es una buena manera de tener dinero para poder darles lo necesario a sus hijos. Este negocio  que es el de tener una tienda  le gusta y le va bien gracias a Dios. Trabaja todos los días sola. la dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia  . a futuro anhela tener su negocio grande y tener su vivienda en buen estado . con el préstamo comprara (enlatados, bebidas, granos).
texts.en: Angela is 55 years old and lives in Fort Guayaquil. She decided to start this business because she needed a way to earn money and support her children with the things that they need. She has a store. She likes this work and it is going well, thanks to God. She works alone everyday. It is difficult when she can’t be at work. Her goal is to have a bigger business and a stable house. With this loan she will buy canned goods, drinks and grains.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, drinks and grains.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 63 years old. She lives in Yerevan with her husband and son's family. Anahit and her husband run a little shop where they trade in food. The couple has been involved in this business for 5 years. 

Anahit needs some financial investments to increase the product variety in her shop. With the requested amount, she will purchase more food, which will allow her to increase the sales. 

Anahit dreams of opening one more shop.  The development of her current shop will allow her to make savings and invest for implementation of her goals.

loans.use: buy food items to resell

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en:
Khoeurn, 42, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fruits for more than ten years, earning approximately USD 25 per day. Her husband is involved in growing vegetables to sell. He earns about USD 5 per day. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about USD 8 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Khoeurn is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved from her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family’s living condition.

loans.use: purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is 22 years old.  She wanted to avail of a loan amounting PHP 34,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs. She manages a livestock business, primarily pigs for fattening. May is married and has one child. Her husband is a farmer, planting rice in their field within their village.

May believes that through her business she is able to help her husband sustain their needs. She wants to help her husband to uplift their living, that’s why she engages herself in this kind of business. She will manage well the business and looks toward the success of it.

loans.use: buy hog feed

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
From the hardship of life he had experienced since childhood, Ernesto learned how to be a hard-working man. Ernesto is 32 years of age, married and blessed with one child. His wife is an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker) in the Middle East. Ernesto wants to help his wife even in just a simple way. He realizes that living far from his loved one is difficult because he has two roles to perform for their child.
 
Ernesto has been engaged in a hog raising business for two years. He wants to maintain the business and wishes to develop it without relying on his wife's remittances. Toward this goal, Ernesto wanted to borrow a loan of PHP 32,000 to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for his hogs. He hopes to avail  of the loan and will use it for the growth of his business.

loans.use: buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for his hogs

loans.name: Norwina

texts.en:
Norwina is a business-oriented woman. She is 35 years of age and married to Francisco. The couple is blessed with three children. 

Norwina sells different kinds of frozen foods in the morning while in the afternoon she sells different kinds of street foods. With her determination to improve their way of living, she patiently offers her frozen foods on a house-to-house basis. Her customers also go directly to her place. She is indeed grateful because as days passed by, her sales had increased.  By this time she is able to dispose of 50 kilograms of frozen foods a week.  According to her, she has been in this kind of business for more than nine years.  The income generated from this business was used to cover all their household expenditures and the education of her three children. 

Norwina would like to buy more frozen and street foods to sell, but her capital is not sufficient due to the high cost of basic commodities.  For this reason, Norwina is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 50,000. She knows that this amount will really help her in making her business more profitable and productive.

loans.use: buy food to resell

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Thol, 50, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in an agricultural business for more than twenty years.  She has extensive experience and is successful in her career. 

Thol is involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle. She earns approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Four of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about USD 16 per day. 

Thol wants to rebuild her present house. With this goal in mind, Thol is requesting a loan of USD 1500 to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house. This money will her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop for her children and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: buy construction materials to rebuild her house

loans.name: Roza

texts.en:
Roza is 24 years old. She lives in Noyakert village with her family: her 50-year-old father, 47-year-old mother, two brothers and one sister-in-law. Though Roza's father and brother work, the main source of income for the family is agriculture. They run a farm where they have a grape orchard, grow peach, apricot and cherry trees and breed a cow.
 
Roza has applied for this loan to improve her orchard and start the land cultivation. With the requested amount, she will purchase fertilizer and poles and wires for the grape trees. This will help Roza to gather a good harvest, which means additional income and improved living conditions for her family.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, poles and wires for her orchard

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma has three children who hold a degree. She manages a sari-sari store business in their village. Gemma generates income by selling various commodities like powder juice and snack foods. Gemma has run this business for 10 years. She is proud to share that through her income generated from the business, she was able to provide her children allowances for school.

Gemma dreams to extend the products she offers to her customers. Due to financial constraint, Gemma could not satisfy what her customers wanted to buy. Hence, she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy eggs, spices, and canned goods for additional products to sell in their village.

loans.use: buy eggs, spices, and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom, 31, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working as a metal sculptor for more than ten years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband runs a taxi service (motor taxi). He earns about USD 3 per day. All of her children are still in her care and in school. 

Mom is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a plot of land for building a house. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store to generate more income to support her family and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: buy land to build a house

loans.name: Karine

texts.en: Karine is a 51-year-old retailer from Yerevan. She rents a premise where she trades in clothing. Karine would like to refresh the variety of clothing in her store for the coming summer season, for which she has applied for this loan. This will allow her to increase the sales and get additional income. The latter is important for Karine to pay for her daughter's education, who studies at the university.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Victoria Esmerita

texts.es: Victoria    de  49  años vive (paraíso   Guayaquil). Ella decidió entrar a este negocio porque es una buena manera de tener dinero para poder darle lo necesario a sus hijos . Este negocio  que es el de  venta de comida le gusta y le va bien gracias a Dios . Trabaja todos los días sola. la dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia ya que su esposo la abandono y tiene que ver se que manera salir adelante   . a futuro anhela tener su negocio grande y tener su vivienda en buen estado . con el préstamo comprara ( materiales de vivienda como cemento, pintura, bloques ).
texts.en: Victoria is 49 years old and lives in Guayaquil Paradise. She began this business, as it was a good way to provide her children with the necessities that they require. She sells prepared food. It is going well and she likes the work, thanks to God. She works alone everyday. It is difficult when she can’t be at work. Her goal is to have a bigger business and a stable house. With this loan she will buy home construction supplies such as cement, paint and cement blocks.

loans.use: to buy cement, paint and cement block.

loans.name: Cristhian Richar

texts.es: Cristhian de 35 años vive (Quevedo Ecuador). El comenzó este negocio alquilando un carro a un amigo y vio que era un buen negocio y decidió independizarse lo hizo y hasta ahora le va bien. Trabaja todos los días solo . es casado tiene 3 hijos a futuro el anhela tener su casa . con el préstamo comprar ( materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, pintura)
texts.en: Cristhian is 35 years old and lives in Quevado, Ecuador. He began his business by renting a friend’s car. He saw that this was a good business so he decided to support himself with this business. As of today, it is going well. He works alone everyday. He is married and has three children. In the future he hopes to have his own house. With this loan he will buy construction materials such a cement, sand and paint.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and paint.

loans.name: Sona

texts.en: Sona is 54 years old. She lives in Burastan village with her 58-year-old husband, Gevorg, and 60-year-old sister, Siramarg. The family is involved in agriculture: land cultivation and cattle breeding. Sona wants to develop poultry breeding, for which she has applied for this loan. With the requested amount, she plans to purchase 4,000 chickens, as well as food to feed them. Sona also plans to use the loan amount for purchasing fertilizer for land cultivation. Development of poultry breeding will allow Sona to make more income from agriculture and invest in its further expansion.

loans.use: to pay for chickens, food for chickens, and fertilizer

loans.name: Guido Alberto

texts.es: Guido tiene 22 años es soltero. Nació en Salinas pero desde los 10 años vive en La Libertad. Nos cuenta que su tierra natal es muy bella, como es costera tiene una playas amplias y hermosas. Salinas es una de las playas de Guayas muy conocida por el turismo. Su clima, sus playas, sus habitantes,  gastronomía son del deleite de extranjeros y locales. Guido dio sus primeros pasos como vendedor ambulante cuando tenía 17 años. Le gusta mucho hablar y ser proactivo por ese motivo hace 2 años decidió independizarse. Ahora tiene un local de ventas de camas, juegos de sala, comedor, colchones en la zona céntrica de La Libertad. Nos cuenta que aun no se ha casado ni tiene hijos porque es joven y desea crecer más económicamente para ofrecerles un futuro seguro. El préstamo lo va a utilizar aumentando su inventario con la compra de Closet y anaqueles. Su meta próxima es abrir otro local en su propia casa para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Guido is 22 years old and single. He was born in Salinas, but he has lived in La Libertad ever since he was 10 years old. He tells us that his hometown is very beautiful and, since it's a coastal town, it has wide and charming beaches. Salinas is one of the beaches in Guayas and it's very well-known among tourists. Its climate, beaches, inhabitants and gastronomy are a pleasure for both foreigners and locals. Guido first started working as a traveling salesman when he was 17 years old. He very much enjoys talking and being proactive, and for that reason he decided to become independent two years ago. He currently owns a store in the central area of La Libertad where he sells beds, mattresses and living and dining room suites. He reports that he hasn't gotten married or had children yet because he's young and wishes to get ahead so that he can provide them with a secure future. He will use the loan to increase his inventory by purchasing closets and shelves. His next goal is to open another store from his own home in order to increase his profits.

loans.use: to purchase shelves and closets.

loans.name: Solanda Ermita

texts.es: Solanda   de 53 años vive  (guasmo Guayaquil). Ella  decidió entrar a este negocio porque es una buena manera de tener dinero para poder darles lo necesario a sus hijos. Este negocio  es tener una tienda de víveres  . Le gusta y le va bien gracias a Dios. Trabaja todos los días solo. La dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia. A futuro anhela tener su negocio grande y tener en buen estado su casa. Con el préstamo comprara (  viveres como granes, carnes, frutas )
texts.en: Solanda is 53 years old and lives in Guasmo, Guayaquil. She decided to begin this business, as it is a good way to have the money to provide her children with the necessities they require. She sells prepared food. She likes the work and it is going well, thanks to God. She works alone everyday. It is difficult when she can’t be at work. Her goal for the future is to have a bigger business and a stable house. With this loan she will buy supplies for her business such as grains, meats and fruit.

loans.use: to buy grains, meat and fruit.

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en:
Nelli is 50 years old. She lives in Berkanush village with her family. Nelli's husband, Hrant, is 51. He works at the local electric power station. Her son, Artyom, is 26 and is involved in agriculture with his parents. They run a farm, where they grow tomatoes, alfalfa, and peach and apricot trees. The family started this business 15 years ago. 
Nelli wants to start pig breeding. She also needs financial means to start land cultivation. With the help of this loan, she will purchase five pigs and fertilizer. Nelli expects to gather a rich harvest, sell it, and get more income. Pig breeding is also important for the increase in income, which means improvement of the household and higher living standards for Nelli's family.

loans.use: to pay for five pigs and fertilizer

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
El señor Jorge Luis esta casado, tiene 24 años de edad, cursó los 4 años de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos los cuales aun no estudian, se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes típicos, inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de sus padres, lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa.

Solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en su trabajo, compra de hilos de diferente colores y clases, espera en el futuro tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is married and 24 years old. He has a fourth grade education. He has two children that are not in school. He works as a weaver, making artisanal products. He started this business with the help of his parents. He has been doing this for the past ten years, with the support of his wife.
He is asking for this loan in order to invest in his business. He will buy yarn of different colors and classes. His dream for the future is to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy yarn for his weaving business.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es: Luz    de 52 años vive  (isla   Guayaquil). Ella  decidió entrar a este negocio porque es una buena manera de tener dinero para poder darles lo necesario a sus hijos. Este negocio  es la venta de cosméticos a parte vende leche de soya y ropa  poco a poco comenzó y logro escogió este negocio porque le daba  tiempo para cuidar a sus hijos. Le gusta y le va bien gracias a Dios. Trabaja todos los días sola  . La dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia. A futuro anhela tener su negocio grande y tener en buen estado su casa. Con el préstamo comprara (mercaderia como ropa, perfumes, cremas)
texts.en: Luz is 52 years old and lives in Guayaquil Island. She started this business, as it was a good way to provide her children with the necessities they require. She sells cosmetic and also soy mild and clothes. Little by little she started this business as it took time to care for her children. She likes the work and the business is going well, thanks to God. She works alone everyday. It is difficult when she can’t be at work. Her dream for the future is to have a bigger business and a stable house. With this loan she will buy merchandise such as clothes, perfumes and creams.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfume and cream.

loans.name: Mariana Mercedes

texts.es: Marian a  de 58 años vive  (paraíso  Guayaquil). Ella  decidió entrar a este negocio porque es una buena manera de tener dinero para poder darles lo necesario a sus hijos. Este negocio  es la venta de comidas poco a poco comenzó y logro ponerse un restaurante lo que ella deseaba lo logro . Le gusta y le va bien gracias a Dios. Trabaja todos los días con  un empleado y un ahijado . La dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia. A futuro anhela tener su negocio grande y tener en buen estado su casa. Con el préstamo comprara (víveres como frutas, carnes, granos).
texts.en: Marian is 58 years old and lives in Paradise, Guayaquil. She started this business, as it was a good way to provide her children with the necessities they require. She sells prepared food. She started this business slowly and eventually she was able to start a restaurant. She likes the work and the business is going well, thanks to God. She works each day with an employee and her godchild. It is difficult when she can’t be at work. Her dream for the future is to have a larger business and a home in good repair. With this loan she will buy supplies like fruit, meat and grains.

loans.use: to buy fruit, meat and grains

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily's goal in life is to uplift her family's standard of living. She is not tired of helping her husband to maintain and develop their source of income, which is farming. Lily is married and has two children who are in school.

With the high cost of farm inputs now in the market, Lily can’t afford to buy all materials needed for the large crop of rice in their field. Lily wants to borrow PHP 50,000 to buy rice seeds to grow on their two hectares of farmland and fertilizers to apply to the site. She hopes to get productive crops in their rice field.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for their two hectares of farmland

loans.name: Thear

texts.en:
Thear, 32, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries  for more than seven years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about USD 5 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s standard of living, Thear would like to run an additional business. Therefore, Thear is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase piglets to breed and to resell when they gain weight. By doing so, she will be able to generate extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to breed and to resell when they gain weight

loans.name: Yolanda Yenny

texts.es: Yolanda  de 44 años vive  (paraíso  Guayaquil). Ella  decidió entrar a este negocio porque es una buena manera de tener dinero para poder darles lo necesario a sus hijos. Este negocio  es de tener  un bazar de esta manera podía cuidar a sus hijos. Le gusta y le va bien gracias a Dios. Trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de su esposo. La dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia. A futuro anhela tener su negocio grande y tener en buen estado su casa. Con el préstamo comprara (papeleria, cuadernos)
texts.en: Yolanda is 44 years old and lives in Paradise, Guayaquil. She started this business, as it was a good way to provide her children with the necessities they require. Her business is a bazaar. This is how she can care for her children. She likes the work and the business is going well, thanks to God. She works each day with the assistance of her husband. It is difficult when she can’t be at work. Her dream for the future is to have a larger business and a home in good repair. With this loan she will buy paper goods and notebooks.

loans.use: to buy paper goods and notebooks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a machine for making cotton candy

loans.name: Celia Jannet

texts.es: Cecilia   de 36  años vive  (playa Guayaquil). Ella  decidió entrar a este negocio porque es una buena manera de tener dinero para poder darles lo necesario a sus hijos. Este negocio  es de vender ropa playera   comenzó hace 3 años porque desde que su esposo la abandono  independizarse comenzó poco a poco hasta que encontró un puesto en el malecón de playa. Le gusta y le va bien gracias a Dios. Trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijas. La dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia. A futuro anhela tener su negocio grande y tener en buen estado su casa  . Con el préstamo comprara (congelador)
texts.en: Cecilia is 36 years old and lives in Playa (Beach), Guayaquil. She started her business, as it was a good way to provide her children with the necessities they require. She sells beach clothes. She began this business three years ago when her husband abandoned her. Little by little she began this business in order to be independent. Finally she was able to have a booth on the beach boardwalk. . She likes the work and the business is going well, thanks to God. She works every day with the help of her daughters. . Her dream for the future is to have a larger business and a home in good repair. With this loan she will buy a freezer.

loans.use: to buy uniforms and shoes.

loans.name: Roza

texts.en:
Roza is 38 years old. She lives in Abovyan village with her family. Roza works at the personnel department hospital of the hospital in nearest city, Artashat. Roza's husband is a taxi driver, and her parents-in-law are involved in cattle breeding. Roza's children are school age. 

In addition to her job, Roza is also involved in agriculture: land cultivation and cattle breeding. She has applied for this loan to develop the farm. With the requested amount she will purchase calves and construct a greenhouse, which will allow her to grow fruit and vegetables in the winter season and to provide stable income for her family.

loans.use: to pay for calves and greenhouse construction

loans.name: Flora Maria

texts.es: Flora  de 64  años vive  (isla  Guayaquil). Ella  decidió entrar a este negocio porque es una buena manera de tener dinero para poder darles lo necesario a sus hijos. Este negocio  es de poner un restaurante  comenzó hace 3 años porque decidió independizarse y no ser mas empleada. Le gusta y le va bien gracias a Dios. Trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de su hija  . La dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia. a futuro anhela tener su negocio grande y tener en buen estado su casa  . Con el préstamo comprara (congelador)
texts.en:
Flora is 64 years old and lives in Guayaquil Island. She started her business, as it was a good way to provide her children with the necessities they require. This is a restaurant business. She decided to begin this business three years ago so she wouldn’t be an employee any more. She likes the work and the business is going well, thanks to God. She works every day with the help of her daughter. It is difficult when she can’t be at work. Her dream for the future is to have a larger business and a home in good repair.
